Today, they will face a Team_5 side who haven’t beaten the Blades in their last seven league fixtures, with their last victory coming back in 2005.
Team_5 will be looking to turn their away form around after a tricky run of games on the road. Roberto De Zerbi’s side are winless in their last six away Premier League matches (D2 L4), their longest winless run away from the Amex Stadium since a seven-game streak under Graham Potter between September and December 2021. The Seagulls lost 2-1 against Team_18 in their previous fixture, conceding a last-minute goal with Brennan Johnson scoring the winner. Playing against the side who currently sit bottom of the Premier League could be a chance to gain some momentum, but the Blades showed plenty of fight last time out.
Team_17 (5-4-1): Wes Foderingham; Yasser Larouci,\xa0Anel Ahmedhodzic, Mason Holgate, Jack Robinson, Jayden Bogle; James McAtee, Vinicius Souza, Gustavo Hamer, Ben Osborn; William Osula.
Team_17 SUBS: Auston Trust, Rhian Brewster, Oliver McBurnie, Ivo Grbic, Oliver Norwood, Tom Davies, Oliver Arblaster, Andre Brooks, Billy Blacker.
Team_5 (3-4-2-1): Bart Verbruggen; Adam Webster, Lewis Dunk, Jan Paul van Hecke; Tariq Lamptey, Billy Gilmour, Facundo Buonanotte, Pascal Gross; Kaoru Mitoma, Simon Adingra; Danny Welbeck.
Team_5 SUBS: Igor Julio, Jakub Moder, Carlos Baleba, Jason Steele, Evan Ferguson, Pervis Estupinan, Ansu Fati, Joel Veltman, Benicio Baker-Boaitey.
Wilder has made two changes from Team_17’s 3-1 victory over Luton in their previous match. In defence, Larouci comes in for the injured Rhys Norrington-Davies and is likely to slot in at left-back. Up front, joint-top goalscorer Cameron Archer misses out, with Osula coming into the starting XI.
Meanwhile, De Zerbi has made three alterations from Team_5’s 2-1 defeat at Team_18 last time out. In goal, Steele drops out of the team and will be replaced by Verbruggen. At the back, Webster is named in the starting XI, with Estupinan dropping to the bench. Adam Lallana fails to make the squad, so Adingra will play from the beginning of the match.
The players are making their way out onto the pitch ahead of kick-off.
Gilmour gets the game under way for Team_5 at Bramall Lane!
Early chance for Team_17! McAtee dances through the challenges of multiple Team_5 defenders and creates space for himself outside the box. He turns and spots the run of Bogle inside the penalty area, before feeding the ball into his path. Bogle gets it out of his feet and takes aim towards the bottom corner, but Verbruggen gets down well to make the save.
Dunk sends a searching ball over the top looking for the run of Lamptey, but\xa0Ahmedhodzic does well to intercept. Team_5 now have a throw-in in a dangerous position, but Welbeck handles the ball after play resumes. The Seagulls are dominating the possession in the early stages, as expected.
So close to a Team_5 opener! Webster plays a ball into the channel which Adingra latches onto it. He shifts it onto his right and delivers low into the area towards Welbeck.\xa0Ahmedhodzic flings himself in front of the cross and it's heading towards goal, but Foderingham palms it away. The ball was inches away from creeping over the line!
Team_5 keep the ball across the back line, patiently waiting for an opening. Van Hecke receives it and spots the run of Gross beyond the Team_17 defence. Gross has burst away unmarked, but he can't quite get it under control and the ball falls to Foderingham between the sticks.
Holgate gets his marching orders! Mitoma twists and turns and drives towards the Team_17 defence. Holgate steps out and makes a reckless challenge on the Team_5 winger at knee height. The referee originally gave a yellow card, but after a quick review from VAR, he's been sent off!
There's a problem for Team_17 now as goalkeeper Foderingham has gone down. The medical team are on the pitch and giving him treatment at the moment and there will be a short delay as he receives attention. He's now back on his feet, and it looks as though he will be able to continue.
It was always going to be a tricky game for the Blades as they fight to pick up points in their battle to climb out of the relegation zone, but an early red card for Holgate has made things a lot more difficult. Wilder has changed the shape slightly and it's certainly not ideal to have to alter their game plan in the first half.
What a chance! Mitoma and Lamptey link up on the left-hand side before the ball comes back to Dunk. He whips a dangerous cross towards Welbeck who can't quite get there, and Robinson gets an important touch at the back post with\xa0Buonanotte flying in. He was unmarked at the back, but the Team_17 defender has put it behind for a corner.
GOOOOOOAAAAAL!! 1-0 Team_5!! The corner comes into the box and is delivered to the back post. Dunk heads it back across and\xa0Buonanotte helps it towards goal. The Team_17 defence attempts to clear it, but the ball creeps over the line. The referee checks his watch, and he's given it! The Blades will have a mountain to climb now with 10 men.
Dunk unselfishly helped the corner back across goal and\xa0Buonanotte was there to nod it home.
GOOOOAAAAALLLL!! 2-0 Team_5! The Seagulls are running riot! Gross and Webster exchange passes before the former delivers towards the back post. Mitoma comes flying in and takes a shot towards goal, but Foderingham palms it out. It falls straight into the path of Welbeck, and the English striker slams the ball home to double Team_5 lead!
Team_5 are continuing to push and Team_17 are struggling to deal with wave after wave of attacks. The ball comes into the box and the Blades can't quite clear it, and it falls to Adingra who sends a volley towards goal, but it flies over the bar and out for a goal-kick. Wilder's side need to settle down and try and remain resolute at the back.
Almost a third from Team_5! Mitoma twists and turns and gets to the byline, leaving Bogle in his shadow. He strikes towards goal but his shot is blocked, before Gross and Welbeck both attempt to find a third as there's a scramble inside the box, but Team_17 manage to clear the danger.
Wilder has decided to make a change in order to shore up his defence. Osula comes off and Team_17 bring on a central defender, with Trusty entering the fray.
The Blades are struggling to get out of their own half at the moment, and the substitution from Wilder hints that they could be going for damage limitation in this game. They need to tighten up at the back with Team_5 dominating proceedings, or it could get messy for Team_17.
Since the game got under way, Team_5 have made 160 passes inside the opposition half, touching the ball in Team_17 box 17 times. The Seagulls have had 78.4 per cent of the possession and are looking comfortable, helped by Holgate's sending-off earlier in the match.
Team_17 have looked tighter at the back since the change and are attempting to hit Team_5 on the counter-attack. Osborn wins it back and looks to spot the run of McAtee who has burst forward from midfield, but his touch is a little heavy and the ball rolls through to Verbruggen.
Adingra stands up his marker and looks to float a cross towards the back post with Mitoma waiting. It's headed away but Webster chests the ball back into the feet of Adingra, who shifts it onto his right foot and strikes towards goal, but it sails over the bar and behind for a goal-kick.
Another opportunity for Team_5. Lamptey receives the ball on the left-hand side of the box and works it onto his right foot, before delivering into the penalty area. Welbeck rises highest and attempts to head towards goal, but he gets it all wrong and it flies into the stands behind the goal.
Team_17 have an opportunity from a corner. McAtee bursts down the line and gets in a foot race with Van Hecke, before the Team_5 defender puts it behind. It's delivered towards the back post and then headed back across goal, and Osborn puts it into the back of the net! But wait... the referee has blown his whistle, and it won't count! VAR is checking it. The referee is taking a look at the monitor... he sticks with his decision, NO GOAL!
The fourth official has indicated that there will be a minimum of seven minutes of added time at the end of the first half.
Team_5 are looking to keep possession in the final few minutes of the half as they try and prevent Team_17 getting a goal before half-time. The Seagulls are remaining patient and waiting for an opening, but the Blades are camped inside their own box hoping to remain tight and maintain the current scoreline.
A corner comes into the box from Gross towards Dunk, and the Team_5 defender manages to head it toward goal. It's flying towards the top corner, but Foderingham makes a superb stop to tip it over the bar and behind for another corner to the Seagulls. Gross delivers again, but Team_17 are able to clear.
Lamptey goes into the book for a strong challenge as Team_17 looked to break.
HALF-TIME: Team_17 0-2 Team_5
Team_5 go into the break with a 2-0 lead over Team_17 at Bramall Lane. The Blades started brightly and were applying pressure on the Seagulls, but Holgate made a reckless challenge on Mitoma early in the first half, and after a VAR review, the referee sent the defender off. From that moment on, Wilder's side were up against it. Shortly after, Team_5 took the lead as\xa0Buonanotte headed home from a few yards out. It didn't take long for De Zerbi's men to grab a second, with Welbeck pouncing inside the box to fire the ball into the back of the net. Team_17 did have the ball in the back of the net through Osborn, but the goal was disallowed due to offside. The home team have a mountain to climb in the second half.
After his side had conceded twice and were down to 10 men, Wilder opted to bring on a defender for his only striker on the pitch. Team_5 created 2.18 expected goals (xG) in the first half, so the Team_17 boss had to tighten up his defence. The Blades became more resolute and prevented another goal after Trusty was brought on, but the supporters at Bramall Lane might want to see a little more in the final third. Although it's an uphill task to get back into the game, Wilder's men need all the points they can get. Could we see Brewster or McBurnie introduced early in the second half as they push to find the back of the net?
De Zerbi makes a change at the break. In defence, Igor is introduced for Webster.
Lamptey is also substituted for Team_5, and Moder will come on in his place.
McAtee gets the second half under way for Team_17 at Bramall Lane!
Team_5 are keeping the ball well in the early stages of the second half, relaxing in possession and remaining patient. Gilmour now finds Mitoma out wide and the Japanese winger cuts inside onto his right foot, but his shot is blocked and Team_17 are able to clear.
McAtee finds Larouci on the left-hand side in plenty of space and Team_17 look to break. He attempts to take on Van Hecke, but Adingra works hard to get back and dispossess the full-back. The Blades need to make the most of these opportunities whenever they win back possession, as Team_5 aren't allowing them to have a lot of the ball.
Team_5 work the ball well as Van Hecke finds himself in space just outside the penalty area. He fakes to shoot and then fires a pass into the feet of Adingra. The Team_5 winger turns and gets away from his marker, before striking towards goal. However, it's a tame effort and Foderingham makes a comfortable stop.
The Blades enjoy a spell of possession inside the Team_5 half. They take a quick throw-in and the ball reaches Souza in space outside the box. He gets it out of his feet and attempts an ambitious long-range effort, but he drags it wide of the post and it goes behind for a goal-kick to Team_5.
Buonanotte is the latest player to go into the referee's book for a late challenge in the middle of the pitch.
Team_17 attempt to hit Team_5 on the counter-attack again. A corner comes into the box and Foderingham comes out to collect it. He quickly fires a long ball beyond De Zerbi's defence and McAtee latches onto it. He delays as he waits for support from his team-mates, but the Team_5 defence outnumber him and win the ball back.
Mitoma contiunes to cause issues for Team_17 down the left-hand side. He receives the ball and instantly looks to take on Bogle, drifting past the defender and getting to the byline with ease. He fires a shot towards goal, but it's deflected behind for a corner. Gross delivers into the box, but Bogle can head it clear.
Wilder makes another alteration as Team_17 look to get back into the game. Larouci makes his way to the bench, and Brooks will enter the fray.
Buonanotte, who opened the scoring for Team_5 in today's game, is substituted. Ferguson will come on to replace him.
Another chance for Team_5! The Seagulls have a corner and Gross is standing over it. He delivers towards the six-yard box and Ferguson makes a run away from goal, twisting and getting his head to it. Unfortunately for him, it's straight at Foderingham who makes a comfortable save.
Team_5 have continued to dominate the possession in the second half, making 111 passes in the final third while having 86.9 per cent of the possession. Team_17 are camped inside their own half and attempting to hit the Seagulls in transition. Credit to the Blades' defence, they've looked a lot more compact since the break.
As it stands, Team_5 will climb into seventh place in the Premier League table if they secure the three points in today's game. Team_17 will remain at the bottom of the table, seven points adrift of Team_12 who sit in 17th place, if they fail get back into the match.
GOOOAAAAALLLL!! 3-0 Team_5! Could that be game over? Mitoma receives the ball on the left-hand side and looks to take on Bogle. He works the ball onto his left foot and delivers a dangerous cross into the penalty area. Robinson darts across the front post and attempts to clear it, but he fires it into the back of his own net. Nothing is going right for the Blades in today's game.
Mitoma, who recently came back from injury, is taken off by De Zerbi. Fati is the player to replace him.
GOOOOAAAAAALLL!! 4-0 Team_5!! Dunk finds Gross out wide and the Team_5 man looks to whip a delivery into the box. Adingra gets across his marker and volleys the ball towards goal, and it flies into the corner of the net. The Ivory Coast international recently won the African Cup of Nations with his country, and he's back with the Seagulls and scoring goals!
It was a perfect cross from Gross onto the foot of Adingra, who only had to help the ball on its way into the back of the net.
McAtee has found it difficult to get into the game in the second half, and he's been replaced by Brewster in attack.
Team_17 make another change and this time in midfield, with Davies replacing Hamer.
Norwood will come on for the Blades in the latter stages of the game, with Osborn making his way to the bench.
Team_5 make an alteration, with Estupinan entering the fray. Welbeck is replaced for the Seagulls.
Norwood plays in Brooks down the left-hand side and he sends a first-time cross into the box, but Igor is there to clear it away. Team_17 have a throw-in and Robinson will launch it into the penalty area. Dunk heads it away but straight back to Robinson. He floats in a cross and\xa0Ahmedhodzic nods it towards goal, but it goes wide of the post.
GOOOAAAAALLLL!! 5-0 Team_5! The Seagulls are running riot! De Zerbi’s side keep possession just outside the penalty area before Fati attempts a strike towards goal. His shot is blocked but it finds Adingra. The Team_5 winger hits it, and it deflects into the far corner of the goal, leaving Foderingham rooted to his spot! Wilder will be hoping to hear the full-time whistle as soon as possible.
All the noise is coming from the away end at Bramall Lane, with a large section of the Team_17 support heading for the exits. They've seen enough as Wilder's side struggle to get back into the game. The Seagulls have been relentless in front of goal and are showing no mercy!
Gilmour goes into the book for dragging Brooks to the ground as Team_17 attempted to break away.
The fourth official has indicated that there will be a minimum of five minutes of added time at the end of the game.
Verbruggen tussles with Davies after Team_17 win a corner, and the Team_5 goalkeeper is given a yellow card.
Davies goes into the book for his involvement in an altercation with Verbruggen.
FULL-TIME: Team_17 0-5 Team_5
Team_5 secure the three points at Bramall Lane with an emphatic 5-0 victory over struggling Team_17. The Blades had a mountain to climb from the early stages of the game after Holgate was sent off for a reckless challenge on Mitoma. Shortly after, Team_5 struck twice through Buonanotte and Welbeck and the Seagulls went into the break with a 2-0 lead against 10 men. De Zerbi's side came out in the second half with plenty of attacking intent despite their comfortable position in the game, and an own goal from Robinson made it three for Team_5. The Blades were a lot more compact in the second half, but the Seagulls continued to be relentless in front of goal, and a double from Adingra later in the game secured the victory at Bramall Lane. Up next for Team_17 is a difficult trip to Wolverhampton Wanderers, while Team_5 will host Team_9 at the Amex Stadium next Saturday. That's all for today, goodbye!"]
label: Exciting

events:
Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Premier League clash between Chelsea and Aston Villa at Stamford Bridge.
Chelsea need to get back to winning ways in the Premier League after losing to Nottingham Forest and drawing with Bournemouth last time out. Mauricio Pochettino's men have struggled in the final third, continuing their poor record in front of goal from the last campaign. The Blues have only won one of their opening five games and are in dire need to a momentum boost to kickstart their season.
Villa have had an up and down start to the season. Their campaign began with a 5-1 hammering against Newcastle United, but wins against Burnley, Everton and Crystal Palace have highlighted their prowess in front of goal. However, there are defensive deficiencies that were on show against the Magpies, Liverpool and in their Europa Conference League defeat to Legia Warsaw last time out. Unai Emery will be looking for an improvement from his side today.
CHELSEA (4-2-3-1): Robert Sanchez; Malo Gusto, Axel Disasi, Thiago Silva, Levi Colwill; Conor Gallagher, Moises Caicedo; Raheem Sterling, Enzo Fernandez, Mykhailo Mudryk; Nicolas Jackson.
CHELSEA SUBS: Marc Cucurella, Chimuanya Ugochukwu, Armando Broja, Cole Palmer, Ben Chilwell, Dorde Petrovic, Ian Maatsen, Deivid Washington, Lucas Bergstrom.
ASTON VILLA (4-2-3-1): Emiliano Martinez; Matty Cash, Ezri Konsa, Pau Torres, Lucas Digne; Boubacar Kamara, Douglas Luiz, John McGinn, Moussa Diaby, Nicolo Zaniolo; Ollie Watkins.
ASTON VILLA SUBS: Youri Tielemans, Calum Chambers, Clement Lenglet, Jhon Duran, Robin Olsen, Leon Bailey, Leander Dendoncker, Jacob Ramsey, Omari Kellyman.
Chelsea have made one change to their side that drew against Bournemouth last time out. Caicedo returns from injury and replaces Ugochukwu in the middle of the park alongside Gallagher. Pochettino keeps faith with the same backline that held the Cherries at bay as Colwill continues at left-back. Chilwell remains on the bench.
Villa have made five changes to their side that was beaten by Legia Warsaw during the week. Watkins is back to lead the line in place of Duran. Diaby returns in place of Bailey in the final third, while Douglas Luiz joins Kamara in the midfield. Torres and Cash are also restored to the back four.
The players are out on the pitch so we should be under way shortly.
We're under way at Stamford Bridge.
Mudryk releases the run of Fernandez over the top, but his cross back into the middle evades Jackson and the flag goes up late for offside anyway.
Mudryk almost pounces on a mistake from the visitors at the back, but Konsa gets across quickly to prevent him bearing down on goal.
SAVE! Douglas Luiz loses out to Fernandez and it allows Jackson to feed Caicedo. The midfielder has space to fire at goal, but sends a tame effort straight at Martinez.
Sterling plays the give and go with Jackson down the right flank, but Torres gets across to force a corner.
Disasi tries to connect with Fernandez's corner from the right flank, but it skims his head. It strikes Kamara on the arm, but the Chelsea appeals for a penalty are muted.
Chelsea are probing with menace down the right flank in the early stages through Sterling and Gusto, who are finding space in the wide areas.
Thiago Silva angles a ball over the top for Mudryk down the left flank. He steers a cutback towards Jackson, but Konsa on the slide directs it away from danger.
Colwill makes a break down the left flank and he sends a low cross into the middle. Kamara slides and he knocks the ball off Jackson's arm to earn Villa a free-kick.
Jackson makes a surge into the Chelsea half and skips past one challenge, but Kamara acts to win the ball back for the visitors using his frame to edge out the forward.
Digne gets forward and combines with Zaniolo, who wins a corner off the body of Gallagher.
WHAT A SAVE! Douglas Luiz whips a corner towards the near post that is deflected out to Digne. He powers a strike towards goal on his left foot that Sanchez has to turn over the bar.
Jackson speeds into the box and has Sterling in support. He goes down under pressure from Konsa, but the flag is up for offside anyway.
Fernandez is down after taking a knock in a challenge with Zaniolo. He walks gingerly to his feet, which will something to monitor for Pochettino.
CHANCE! Mudryk threads the needle to release Jackson in the inside-left channel. The forward goes for a first-time strike on his left foot, poking his effort towards goal, but Martinez diverts it behind. Jackson had more time than he thought there.
Jackson has space in the final third, but he takes the path away from goal and his eventual cross towards Fernandez is nodded back to Martinez by Cash.
Chelsea are getting the ball in the right areas, but their decision-making with their final pass and shot has been their downfall today.
Cash is afforded space on the right flank and he takes on the early strike at goal that is deflected into the arms of Sanchez by Colwill.
The visitors have struggled to get control of possession, but have been alert in the final third. With Villa's quality, the hosts cannot afford to lose the ball in their own half.
CHANCE! Gusto bursts down the right flank and cuts the ball back to Fernandez. He has space and time, but scuffs his strike well wide of the target. Fernandez had to hit the target there.
Watkins wins possession for the visitors following a loose pass from Colwill. Caicedo brings down the forward on the charge 25 yards from goal, handing Villa a free-kick in a useful position.
Douglas Luiz lines up a strike at goal, but his effort clips the Chelsea wall and drifts wide for a corner.
SAVE! Sanchez rescues Chelsea again. Kamara rises to head a corner from Douglas Luiz back into a dangerous area. Zaniolo shoots on the turn on the volley, but sees his effort turned over the bar.
Digne latches onto another loose ball on the edge of the Chelsea box following a corner. On this occasion, he lifts his effort comfortably over the top.
Mudryk surges past Cash down the left flank and places a perfect low ball across the face of goal, but both Jackson and Sterling are nowhere to be seen.
Jackson sends Gusto away down the right flank, but he is forced to wait for support and his cutback towards Gallagher is cleared behind.
DISALLOWED GOAL! Disasi heads Gusto's cross into the back of the net with a fine effort, but the offside flag cuts short his celebration.
Digne drags back Sterling on a run off the ball and goes into the book.
There will be three minutes of added time.
HALF-TIME: CHELSEA 0-0 ASTON VILLA
Despite signalling three minutes of added time, the half ends after only two. It's goalless at Stamford Bridge in the Premier League clash between Chelsea and Aston Villa. Villa have had the best chances of the game as Robert Sanchez has been called on twice to deny Lucas Digne and Nicolo Zaniolo with reaction stops. At the other end, Chelsea have had the ball in the next, but Axel Disasi was offside, while Nicolas Jackson also missed a good opportunity.
It has been groundhog day for Chelsea in front of goal. They've got themselves into good positions, but have lacked the clinical edge to get the breakthrough. Disasi should have kept himself onside, while Jackson should have converted his opening. Villa have looked dangerous at times, but have been exposed at the back as well.
We're back under way at Stamford Bridge.
SAVE! Thiago Silva releases Sterling over the top and through on goal. He only has Martinez to beat as he bears down on the target, but the Villa keeper spreads himself to make the stop.
Fernandez curls a fine cross to the back post for Jackson to attack. He connects with a header, but sends it just wide of the target. The flag goes up for offside anyway.
Jackson is booked for encroachment.
OFFSIDE! Chelsea are in behind the high Aston Villa line again. Sterling bursts through on goal, but sees his effort blocked. Once again, the flag goes up late. Sterling and Jackson need to start timing these runs.
Martinez takes a loose touch before his clearance downfield and it results in Jackson blocking the ball, but it bounces back for a goal-kick.
Gusto could be in trouble here as he catches Digne on the ankle with his boot. The referee is being told to look at the screen at the side of the field.
OFF! Gusto is sent off. Having initially been given a yellow card, Gusto's punishment is upgraded to a red for catching Digne on the ankle with an outstretched boot after a VAR check. Chelsea are down to 10 men.
SCRAMBLE! Cash and Douglas Luiz force efforts at goal around the Chelsea box, but the wall of blue shirts hold firm in front of the net to concede only a corner.
Mudryk makes way for Chilwell to shore up the Chelsea defence following Gusto's dismissal.
Zaniolo collects in the final third and has space to shoot, but he sees his effort charged down by Thiago Silva.
Cash goes for a blast from distance, but Sanchez watches it carefully into his hands. Villa are upping the ante now.
Caicedo sends an early ball over the top for Jackson, but he takes a poor first touch and allows Konsa to recover to edge him out in the Villa box.
Gusto, aged 20 years and 128 days, is the third-youngest Chelsea player to receive a Premier League red card.
Ugochukwu enters the action to replace Jackson to shore up the Chelsea midfield.
Palmer is on for Fernandez in the final third.
DIABY HAS TO HIT THE TARGET! The winger collects the ball following a loose header at the back post. He shoots first time, but scuffs his effort into the ground and wide of the target.
GOALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL!!!!!! WATKINS SCORES ON THE BREAK!!!!! 1-0 VILLA! Chelsea pay the price for committing too many men forward as Watkins produces a clinical finish. Gallagher's cutback evades every blue shirt in the box and Villa work the ball forward. Diaby feeds Watkins, who faces off against Colwill on his run into the box. Colwill blocks his first shot, but he buries the second with a finish off the inside of the left post.
Ramsey enters the action to replace McGinn in the Villa midfield.
Bailey replaces Zaniolo in the final third.
SAVE! Chilwell is played into space and only has Martinez to beat, but he fires his left-footed strike straight at Martinez.
Palmer times his throughball to perfection to release Disasi down the right flank. He opens up space to strike at goal on his right foot, but slices his effort wide of the target.
Caicedo is withdrawn as Chelsea need goals. Broja replaces the midfielder.
Watkins sends Diaby through on goal and he surges into the box. He fires low and hard, but Sanchez makes a sharp stop. The flag may have gone up on review there.
Tielemans enters the action for Villa in their midfield for Diaby.
SAVE! Sanchez keeps Chelsea in the game as he turns a curling strike from Ramsey past the post that was seemingly destined for the bottom-right corner.
Konsa attacks the resulting corner from Bailey, only to plant his header over the top.
Chelsea win a free-kick on the left flank that Chilwell delivers deep to the back post that Broja fails to connect with on the slide.
Chilwell brings down Watkins on the charge and goes into the book.
Dendoncker comes on to replace the impressive Kamara.
There will be 11 minutes of added time.
Duran replaces Watkins for the closing stages of the contest.
Douglas Luiz brings down Sterling and is booked.
BLOCK! Konsa sticks out a boot at the vital moment to prevent Palmer's low strike from finding the net after great work from Disasi down the right flank.
Martinez is booked for timewasting.
Sanchez has a concerning moment as a he drops a corner from Douglas Luiz from the left flank, but there was no one in a Villa shirt there to capitalise.
Time is running out for Chelsea to earn a share of the spoils. The Blues have not been good enough in the final third.
Gallagher tees up Palmer for a drive on the edge of the box. He drills a left-footed strike at goal, which is charged down by two defenders.
Bailey pulls back Chilwell on the left flank. Chelsea will have one final chance to send cross into the box.
OFFSIDE! Chelsea see the offside flag raised again as Broja heads Chilwell's cross wide. It has been the story of their day.
Chelsea have been caught offside on 10 occasions today.
FULL-TIME: CHELSEA 0-1 ASTON VILLA
Aston Villa inflict further pain on Chelsea with a 1-0 win in their Premier League clash at Stamford Bridge. After a goalless first period, Malo Gusto was sent off after a VAR checked overturned his yellow card and awarded a red card for a challenge on Lucas Digne in the second half. Villa upped the ante with their numerical advantage and took the lead through a counter as Ollie Watkins buried his chance on the break. The Blues' problems in goal persisted as they failed to find the back of the net for the third game on the bounce and have now only taken one point out of a possible nine from their last three matches. Villa move up to sixth with their victory.
Chelsea are next in action in the EFL Cup against Brighton next week at home. Villa take on Everton in their EFL Cup game on Wednesday at Villa Park.
Thanks for joining our commentary today. Until next time, goodbye.
summary:
Chelsea equalled their biggest win of the season as they came from behind to beat Burnley 4-1 at Turf Moor.
The home side made an excellent start, going ahead in the 15th minute through Wilson Odobert, who at the age of 18 years and 313 days became their youngest-ever goalscorer.
Lyle Foster played a big part in the goal after running at the Chelsea defence before passing left to Odobert. The French winger took a touch before shooting through Marc Cucurella’s legs and into the far corner.
Chelsea fought back and drew level just before half-time through an own goal from Ameen Al Dakhil. The Burnley centre-back diverted the ball over his goalkeeper and into his own net after Raheem Sterling’s cross from the left.
Chelsea completed the turnaround early in the second half through Cole Palmer’s first Premier League goal. He converted a penalty after Sterling was fouled by Vitinho.  
Sterling then capped off an excellent performance with his third Premier League goal of the season when he found the left corner after being set up by Conor Gallagher.
The Blues then capped off a fantastic display when substitute Nicolas Jackson made it 4-1, showing great composure to spin on the ball before firing it in the bottom corner.
Chelsea go 10th with 11 points, while Burnley remain 18th with four.
Burnley report | Chelsea report
Referee: Stuart Attwell. Assistants: Constantine Hatzidakis, James Mainwaring. Fourth official: Oliver Langford. VAR: Darren Bond. Assistant VAR: Eddie Smart.
text:
["Hello and welcome to the live commentary of the Premier League clash between Team_7 and Team_2 at Stamford Bridge.
Team_7 need to get back to winning ways in the Premier League after losing to Team_16 and drawing with Team_3 last time out. Mauricio Pochettino's men have struggled in the final third, continuing their poor record in front of goal from the last campaign. The Blues have only won one of their opening five games and are in dire need to a momentum boost to kickstart their season.
Villa have had an up and down start to the season. Their campaign began with a 5-1 hammering against Team_15, but wins against Team_6, Team_9 and Team_8 have highlighted their prowess in front of goal. However, there are defensive deficiencies that were on show against the Magpies, Team_11 and in their Europa Conference League defeat to Legia Warsaw last time out. Unai Emery will be looking for an improvement from his side today.
Team_7 (4-2-3-1): Robert Sanchez;\xa0Malo Gusto,\xa0Axel Disasi, Thiago Silva, Levi Colwill; Conor Gallagher, Moises Caicedo; Raheem Sterling, Enzo Fernandez,\xa0Mykhailo Mudryk; Nicolas Jackson.
Team_7 SUBS: Marc Cucurella,\xa0Chimuanya Ugochukwu, Armando Broja, Cole Palmer,\xa0Ben Chilwell,\xa0Dorde Petrovic, Ian Maatsen,\xa0Deivid Washington,\xa0Lucas Bergstrom.
Team_2 (4-2-3-1): Emiliano Martinez; Matty Cash,\xa0Ezri Konsa,\xa0Pau Torres,\xa0Lucas Digne;\xa0Boubacar Kamara,\xa0Douglas Luiz, John McGinn,\xa0Moussa Diaby,\xa0Nicolo Zaniolo; Ollie Watkins.
Team_2 SUBS:\xa0Youri Tielemans, Calum Chambers,\xa0Clement Lenglet,\xa0Jhon Duran,\xa0Robin Olsen,\xa0Leon Bailey,\xa0Leander Dendoncker, Jacob Ramsey, Omari Kellyman.
Team_7 have made one change to their side that drew against Team_3 last time out. Caicedo returns from injury and replaces Ugochukwu in the middle of the park alongside Gallagher. Pochettino keeps faith with the same backline that held the Cherries at bay as Colwill continues at left-back. Chilwell remains on the bench.
Villa have made five changes to their side that was beaten by Legia Warsaw during the week. Watkins is back to lead the line in place of Duran. Diaby returns in place of Bailey in the final third, while Douglas Luiz joins Kamara in the midfield. Torres and Cash are also restored to the back four.
The players are out on the pitch so we should be under way shortly.
We're under way at Stamford Bridge.
Mudryk releases the run of Fernandez over the top, but his cross back into the middle evades Jackson and the flag goes up late for offside anyway.
Mudryk almost pounces on a mistake from the visitors at the back, but Konsa gets across quickly to prevent him bearing down on goal.
SAVE! Douglas Luiz loses out to Fernandez and it allows Jackson to feed Caicedo. The midfielder has space to fire at goal, but sends a tame effort straight at Martinez.
Sterling plays the give and go with Jackson down the right flank, but Torres gets across to force a corner.
Disasi tries to connect with Fernandez's corner from the right flank, but it skims his head. It strikes Kamara on the arm, but the Team_7 appeals for a penalty are muted.
Team_7 are probing with menace down the right flank in the early stages through Sterling and Gusto, who are finding space in the wide areas.
Thiago Silva angles a ball over the top for Mudryk down the left flank. He steers a cutback towards Jackson, but Konsa on the slide directs it away from danger.
Colwill makes a break down the left flank and he sends a low cross into the middle. Kamara slides and he knocks the ball off Jackson's arm to earn Villa a free-kick.
Jackson makes a surge into the Team_7 half and skips past one challenge, but Kamara acts to win the ball back for the visitors using his frame to edge out the forward.
Digne gets forward and combines with Zaniolo, who wins a corner off the body of Gallagher.
WHAT A SAVE! Douglas Luiz whips a corner towards the near post that is deflected out to Digne. He powers a strike towards goal on his left foot that Sanchez has to turn over the bar.
Jackson speeds into the box and has Sterling in support. He goes down under pressure from Konsa, but the flag is up for offside anyway.
Fernandez is down after taking a knock in a challenge with Zaniolo. He walks gingerly to his feet, which will something to monitor for Pochettino.
CHANCE! Mudryk threads the needle to release Jackson in the inside-left channel. The forward goes for a first-time strike on his left foot, poking his effort towards goal, but Martinez diverts it behind. Jackson had more time than he thought there.
Jackson has space in the final third, but he takes the path away from goal and his eventual cross towards Fernandez is nodded back to Martinez by Cash.
Team_7 are getting the ball in the right areas, but their decision-making with their final pass and shot has been their downfall today.
Cash is afforded space on the right flank and he takes on the early strike at goal that is deflected into the arms of Sanchez by Colwill.
The visitors have struggled to get control of possession, but have been alert in the final third. With Villa's quality, the hosts cannot afford to lose the ball in their own half.
CHANCE! Gusto bursts down the right flank and cuts the ball back to Fernandez. He has space and time, but scuffs his strike well wide of the target. Fernandez had to hit the target there.
Watkins wins possession for the visitors following a loose pass from Colwill. Caicedo brings down the forward on the charge 25 yards from goal, handing Villa a free-kick in a useful position.
Douglas Luiz lines up a strike at goal, but his effort clips the Team_7 wall and drifts wide for a corner.
SAVE! Sanchez rescues Team_7 again. Kamara rises to head a corner from Douglas Luiz back into a dangerous area. Zaniolo shoots on the turn on the volley, but sees his effort turned over the bar.
Digne latches onto another loose ball on the edge of the Team_7 box following a corner. On this occasion, he lifts his effort comfortably over the top.
Mudryk surges past Cash down the left flank and places a perfect low ball across the face of goal, but both Jackson and Sterling are nowhere to be seen.
Jackson sends Gusto away down the right flank, but he is forced to wait for support and his cutback towards Gallagher is cleared behind.
DISALLOWED GOAL! Disasi heads Gusto's cross into the back of the net with a fine effort, but the offside flag cuts short his celebration.
Digne drags back Sterling on a run off the ball and goes into the book.
There will be three minutes of added time.
HALF-TIME: Team_7 0-0 Team_2
Despite signalling three minutes of added time, the half ends after only two. It's goalless at Stamford Bridge in the Premier League clash between Team_7 and Team_2. Villa have had the best chances of the game as Robert Sanchez has been called on twice to deny Lucas Digne and Nicolo Zaniolo with reaction stops. At the other end, Team_7 have had the ball in the next, but Axel Disasi was offside, while Nicolas Jackson also missed a good opportunity.
It has been groundhog day for Team_7 in front of goal. They've got themselves into good positions, but have lacked the clinical edge to get the breakthrough. Disasi should have kept himself onside, while Jackson should have converted his opening. Villa have looked dangerous at times, but have been exposed at the back as well.
We're back under way at Stamford Bridge.
SAVE! Thiago Silva releases Sterling over the top and through on goal. He only has Martinez to beat as he bears down on the target, but the Villa keeper spreads himself to make the stop.
Fernandez curls a fine cross to the back post for Jackson to attack. He connects with a header, but sends it just wide of the target. The flag goes up for offside anyway.
Jackson is booked for encroachment.
OFFSIDE! Team_7 are in behind the high Team_2 line again. Sterling bursts through on goal, but sees his effort blocked. Once again, the flag goes up late. Sterling and Jackson need to start timing these runs.
Martinez takes a loose touch before his clearance downfield and it results in Jackson blocking the ball, but it bounces back for a goal-kick.
Gusto could be in trouble here as he catches Digne on the ankle with his boot.\xa0The referee is being told to look at the screen at the side of the field.
OFF! Gusto is sent off. Having initially been given a yellow card, Gusto's punishment is upgraded to a red for catching Digne on the ankle with an outstretched boot after a VAR check. Team_7 are down to 10 men.
SCRAMBLE! Cash and Douglas Luiz force efforts at goal around the Team_7 box, but the wall of blue shirts hold firm in front of the net to concede only a corner.
Mudryk makes way for Chilwell to shore up the Team_7 defence following Gusto's dismissal.
Zaniolo collects in the final third and has space to shoot, but he sees his effort charged down by Thiago Silva.
Cash goes for a blast from distance, but Sanchez watches it carefully into his hands. Villa are upping the ante now.
Caicedo sends an early ball over the top for Jackson, but he takes a poor first touch and allows Konsa to recover to edge him out in the Villa box.
Gusto, aged 20 years and 128 days, is the third-youngest Team_7 player to receive a Premier League red card.
Ugochukwu enters the action to replace Jackson to shore up the Team_7 midfield.
Palmer is on for Fernandez in the final third.
DIABY HAS TO HIT THE TARGET! The winger collects the ball following a loose header at the back post. He shoots first time, but scuffs his effort into the ground and wide of the target.
GOALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL!!!!!! WATKINS SCORES ON THE BREAK!!!!! 1-0 VILLA! Team_7 pay the price for committing too many men forward as Watkins produces a clinical finish. Gallagher's cutback evades every blue shirt in the box and Villa work the ball forward. Diaby feeds Watkins, who faces off against Colwill on his run into the box. Colwill blocks his first shot, but he buries the second with a finish off the inside of the left post.
Ramsey enters the action to replace McGinn in the Villa midfield.
Bailey replaces Zaniolo in the final third.
SAVE! Chilwell is played into space and only has Martinez to beat, but he fires his left-footed strike straight at Martinez.
Palmer times his throughball to perfection to release Disasi down the right flank. He opens up space to strike at goal on his right foot, but slices his effort wide of the target.
Caicedo is withdrawn as Team_7 need goals. Broja replaces the midfielder.
Watkins sends Diaby through on goal and he surges into the box. He fires low and hard, but Sanchez makes a sharp stop. The flag may have gone up on review there.
Tielemans enters the action for Villa in their midfield for Diaby.
SAVE! Sanchez keeps Team_7 in the game as he turns a curling strike from Ramsey past the post that was seemingly destined for the bottom-right corner.
Konsa attacks the resulting corner from Bailey, only to plant his header over the top.
Team_7 win a free-kick on the left flank that Chilwell delivers deep to the back post that Broja fails to connect with on the slide.
Chilwell brings down Watkins on the charge and goes into the book.
Dendoncker comes on to replace the impressive Kamara.
There will be 11 minutes of added time.
Duran replaces Watkins for the closing stages of the contest.
Douglas Luiz brings down Sterling and is booked.
BLOCK! Konsa sticks out a boot at the vital moment to prevent Palmer's low strike from finding the net after great work from Disasi down the right flank.
Martinez is booked for timewasting.
Sanchez has a concerning moment as a he drops a corner from Douglas Luiz from the left flank, but there was no one in a Villa shirt there to capitalise.
Time is running out for Team_7 to earn a share of the spoils. The Blues have not been good enough in the final third.
Gallagher tees up Palmer for a drive on the edge of the box. He drills a left-footed strike at goal, which is charged down by two defenders.
Bailey pulls back Chilwell on the left flank. Team_7 will have one final chance to send cross into the box.
OFFSIDE! Team_7 see the offside flag raised again as Broja heads Chilwell's cross wide. It has been the story of their day.
Team_7 have been caught offside on 10 occasions today.
FULL-TIME: Team_7 0-1 Team_2
Team_2 inflict further pain on Team_7 with a 1-0 win in their Premier League clash at Stamford Bridge. After a goalless first period, Malo Gusto was sent off after a VAR checked overturned his yellow card and awarded a red card for a challenge on Lucas Digne in the second half. Villa upped the ante with their numerical advantage and took the lead through a counter as Ollie Watkins buried his chance on the break. The Blues' problems in goal persisted as they failed to find the back of the net for the third game on the bounce and have now only taken one point out of a possible nine from their last three matches. Villa move up to sixth with their victory.
Team_7 are next in action in the EFL Cup against Team_5 next week at home. Villa take on Team_9 in their EFL Cup game on Wednesday at Villa Park.
Thanks for joining our commentary today. Until next time, goodbye."]
label: Exciting

events:
Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League clash between Crystal Palace and Manchester City at Selhurst Park.
Palace started well under new manager Oliver Glasner and beat Burnley 3-0 in his first match in charge, but the Eagles have since failed to win their last four games in the top flight (drawing two and losing two). Their 1-0 loss to Bournemouth in their previous outing was particularly frustrating, with Eberechi Eze's potential opener disallowed for offside after a VAR check before Justin Kluivert struck the winner for the Cherries in the 79th minute. However, it would be a stretch to say Palace deserved anything out of the match at the Vitality Stadium after only creating an xG (expected goals) of 0.19 from their three shots. The Eagles are in 14th position in the Premier League and are eight points above the relegation zone with eight games remaining, meaning there is not much to play for, but Glasner will use the final part of the season to see who is in his plans for the next campaign.
City returned to winning ways in their previous match, beating Champions League hopefuls Aston Villa 4-1 after back-to-back draws with title rivals Liverpool and Arsenal. Jhon Duran cancelled out Rodri's opener to level the score before Phil Foden netted a stunning hat-trick to extend City's unbeaten run in the top flight to 15 games and keep them within three points of table-toppers Liverpool. Pep Guardiola's men will temporarily go above second-place Arsenal with a win. However, they will only move to the summit if they beat Palace by four goals or more. City will be confident of securing a positive result after winning six and drawing two of their last eight Premier League away matches against Palace, and will want to keep spirits high heading into their huge Champions League quarter-final first-leg tie against Real Madrid in Spain next week.
CRYSTAL PALACE (3-4-3): Dean Henderson; Joel Ward, Joachim Andersen, Jefferson Lerma; Daniel Munnoz, Adam Wharton, Will Hughes, Tyrick Mitchell; Eberechi Eze, Jean-Philippe Mateta, Jordan Ayew.
CRYSTAL PALACE SUBS: James Tomkins, Michael Olise, Jeffrey Schlupp, Nathaniel Clyne, Odsonne Edouard, Naouirou Ahamada, Remi Matthews, David Ozoh, Franco Umeh-Chibueze.
MANCHESTER CITY (4-1-4-1): Stefan Ortega; Rico Lewis, John Stones, Ruben Dias, Josko Gvardiol; Rodri; Oscar Bobb, Kevin De Bruyne, Julian Alvarez, Jack Grealish; Erling Haaland.
MANCHESTER CITY SUBS: Mateo Kovacic, Jeremy Doku, Bernardo Silva, Sergio Gomez, Manuel Akanji, Matheus Nunes, Ederson, Phil Foden, Mahamadou Susoho.
Palace name the same side that started their 1-0 loss to Bournemouth in their previous Premier League outing. However, Olise returns to the bench after missing the last seven matches through injury.
City make four alterations to the team that beat Villa 4-1 in their previous match. Despite scoring a hat-trick against the Lions, Foden drops onto the bench and is replaced by De Bruyne, who captains the side. Stones comes in for Akanji at centre-back, and Bobb is picked ahead of Doku on the right. Haaland appears up front and is in the side instead of Silva, meaning Alvarez drops further back. Ederson returns to the squad after getting injured against Liverpool last month, allowing Ortega to start again.
Palace came from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 with City in the reverse fixture in December. Only in 1992-93, 1994-95, and 2021-22 have they avoided defeat in both Premier League meetings with the Citizens in a season. Both teams are on the pitch and are ready to get started.
Palace get this Premier League clash under way. The two teams switched sides before the start.
It will be interesting to see if Palace have a strong start, with the Eagles playing at home with an unchanged side and an extra day of rest compared to City. The visitors might look to build their way into the contest after making four switches. However, it is tough to disagree with Guardiola, who has led his side to a 25-match unbeaten run in all competitions. Haaland is back, but if the Citizens take a healthy lead, he will probably come off early with a huge Champions League tie against Madrid soon.
Bobb wins possession off Eze and helps City break forward quickly down the right side of Palace's half, with De Bruyne winning an early corner. The Belgium international looks for Haaland in the middle, but Andersen heads it clear.
GOALLLL! MATETA SCORES! 1-0 PALACE! What a start for the Eagles! Stones gifts possession to the hosts, who play some quick passes in their own half before Wharton rolls a throughball into Mateta. The striker races down the right side of the box before directing his low shot across the goal and into the net off the left post.
That’s a brilliant pass from Wharton, who finds the run of Mateta. He still has plenty to do but shows great composure to beat Ortega.
Palace had failed to score in any of their last four Premier League home games against City, with Luka Milivojevic in April 2019 the last Eagles player to score against them at Selhurst Park.
WIDE! Huge chance for City to level! De Bruyne has possession on the right and whips a fantastic delivery into the box. Gvardiol stays up from a previous corner and attempts to direct a header on target, but puts his shot wide of the right post.
Palace have another chance to break forward with speed, but Wharton's pass down the left to Eze is wayward of the winger. However, he collects it well and tries to play a one-two with Ayew, who sends the ball out for a goal-kick.
POST! City go close this time! Bobb and Lewis combine on the right before the latter of the pair slides a brilliant pass through to Alvarez, who bursts into the box. The Argentine then drives a low strike across the goal, but it hits the left post before Henderson punches it away.
SAVE! What a stop from Henderson to keep Palace ahead! A cross into the Eagles box is headed away by Lerma as far as Rodri, who directs a first-time effort from just inside the box towards the bottom-right corner. It looks to be heading into the net, but Henderson gets down well to push it around the post.
GOALLLL! WHAT A HIT FROM DE BRUYNE! 1-1! Grealish gets his first chance to dribble at Munoz down the left before his low cross is blocked. However, it rebounds straight to De Bruyne, who switches possession onto his right foot inside the box before curling his perfect strike into the top-right corner.
City have scored 29 first-half goals in 31 games, only Arsenal (33) and Villa (31) have scored more in the Premier League this season. Henderson made a top save to deny Rodri earlier, but that goal from De Bruyne was simply unstoppable.
City have controlled possession so far and have had 87.1 per cent of the ball. Mateta scored the opener for the Eagles, but he is the only player in a home shirt who is staying forward and looks isolated. Any early nerves for Guardiola are probably gone.
OVER! Mitchell lofts a cross into the box from the left, with Ortega getting there before Mateta to punch it away. It drops to Ayew on the edge, but he lashes his effort well over the bar.
ANOTHER SAVE! Henderson is keeping Palace in the contest. De Bruyne spins on the ball just inside the Eagles' half and slides a wonderful throughball into the path of Haaland, who is one-on-one with the goalkeeper. However, Henderson comes out quickly to block his strike.
De Bruyne is appearing all over the pitch, this time getting down the left to get on the end of Grealish's pass down the wing. The captain races towards the byline before his low cross is blocked.
Munoz slides into Grealish, who stays down and looks hurt. It’s a worrying moment for City after Grealish's injury record this season, but he is back on his feet without needing medical treatment.
City have a good spell of possession before Dias breaks their short passing routine with a fantastic switch from left to right over to Bobb. He is in space inside the Palace box, but the ball hits his arm and a free-kick is given. Bobb looks frustrated with himself.
City continue to control the possession, with Palace packing their defensive third to stop the visitors from progressing. Rodri then attempts to chip a pass forward to Alvarez, but Mitchell matches his run to head it away.
Grealish wins a corner off Ward on the right, with the Palace defender heading De Bruyne's first corner behind before then clearing the next one from the same side well away. Two poor deliveries from De Bruyne, which is a surprise due to his quality. There hasn’t been a shot for over 10 minutes.
Gvardiol strolls out of the defence, arriving at the edge of the Palace box before seeing his shot blocked at close range. The Croatian defender and Stones are getting further forward to help increase the City pressure.
Palace are sitting deep, meaning that anytime they win possession or put in a strong tackle, they struggle to keep the ball. Rodri attempts to slide a clever pass down the right side of the box to Haaland, but Mitchell is strong and gets a foot across to poke the ball behind for a corner.
WIDE! Alvarez has time and space just to the right outside Palace’s box, but he fires his effort across the goal and wide of the left post.
De Bruyne shows his invention with a wonderful chipped pass over the Palace defence and down the right side of the box to Bobb, who is in plenty of space. However, he doesn’t race towards the spinning ball. As a result, when it hit the floor, it bounced straight out for a goal-kick. Bobb puts his arms in the air as he realises that it was his fault.
A rare Palace attack, with Mateta getting to the ball before Rodri down the right, and curling a low cross into the box. However, it is too close to Ortega, who collects it well.
BAR! What a chance for Palace to take the lead again! Rodri loses possession in City's half, and Ayew races forward before firing his right-footed effort against the top of the bar!
City have lost control in the last couple of minutes and haven’t been as relaxed in possession. Lewis has a shot on the edge of Palace's box but blasts his effort straight at Henderson.
CHANCE! Munoz breaks down the right for Palace and cuts the ball back to the edge of the box to Ayew, but his touch is very poor. Hughes collects it but is tackled by Rodri, who sends a blind pass back to Ortega. Mateta puts the goalkeeper under pressure. However, the City man turns away from the Frenchman. Ederson would be proud of that one!
Haaland has been involved in seven goals in his last six away appearances for City in the Premier League, scoring four and assisting three. However, he’s not scored in any of his previous four such games, his longest run without a goal on the road in the competition. He has only had seven touches so far!
There will be three minutes of additional time.
Gvardiol thunders into Ayew's back and gives away a free-kick just inside City's half. He then shows his frustrations to the referee, who gives him a yellow card for dissent.
HALF-TIME: CRYSTAL PALACE 1-1 MANCHESTER CITY
De Bruyne scored a fantastic equaliser to cancel out Mateta's opener, with Palace and City level at 1-1 heading into half-time. The Eagles took the lead inside three minutes through Mateta, who raced onto the end of Wharton's brilliant throughball and drove his low strike against the left post and into the net. City levelled less than four minutes later through De Bruyne. The Belgium international collected the ball on the left and whipped a brilliant strike into the top-right corner. Haaland was then denied by a sharp stop from Henderson, with Ayew crashing the bar from the hosts.
Palace struggled to create anything against Bournemouth in their last outing, but they have shown signs of promise against Premier League champions City. The Eagles have registered an xG of 0.75 from their three shots, with their only effort on target coming from Mateta's goal. Henderson has also been brilliant, making four saves. As for City, they created an xG of 0.99 from their nine efforts. Guardiola's men have had 75.9 per cent of the possession. However, they have struggled at times to find a way through Palace's rigid defensive structure and have been vulnerable on the counter. Haaland might be getting frustrated up front after having just seven touches, but with De Bruyne in the side, he could be found at any moment.
City make a change to their defence before the restart. Gvardiol struggled at times before the break and is being replaced by Akanji.
City get the ball rolling again. The visitors must win to keep the pressure on title rivals Arsenal and Liverpool, who will be delighted with the score so far.
GOALLLL! LEWIS SCORES! 2-1 CITY! The visitors take the lead for the first time! Grealish has possession on the left, getting to the byline before lifting a cross into the box. Andersen gets there but flicks a header straight to Lewis, who crashes his strike into the bottom-left corner.
City have scored 11 goals in the first 15 minutes of the second half, only Tottenham (15) have scored more in the Premier League this season. It’s also the second time Lewis has scored this season, with both coming against the Eagles!
There is a small penalty shout for City, with De Bruyne's cross from the left getting blocked by Andersen's arm. However, when the ball struck the arm of the Palace defender, it was close to his body and in a natural position.
Palace now need to stay in the contest and not concede again. Glasner will be furious with conceding just after half-time, especially as Lewis was free inside the box!
Wharton lofts a pass down the right for Munoz, who breaks down the wing and waits for support. He has plenty of time to pick the right option, but his cutback goes straight to Alvarez. The Eagles won’t get many chances, meaning they must do better when they get forward.
CHANCE! What an opportunity for City to take the lead! De Bruyne knocks a header into Haaland, but the ball is just too far in front of the striker. He keeps the attack alive and plays it back to Alvarez in the middle. However, his low strike deflects off Andersen and goes wide of the right post.
De Bruyne is over a corner on the right and drives a low pass to Grealish on the edge of the box. He has time and space, taking one touch before lashing his effort over the top of the bar.
City have been strong since the restart and have not allowed Palace to get into the contest. They have stopped the Eagles from having a shot whilst keeping 70.3 per cent of the possession and eight touches in the opposition box. If City score again, it would be difficult to see Palace from getting any points.
De Bruyne has possession on the left and plays a one-two with Grealish. He then looks at the goal and goes for an ambitious strike from range, curling his effort towards the top-right corner but over the bar. However, after his goal earlier, there would be no surprise if that went in!
Grealish, De Bruyne and Haaland all combine with some quick passes in tight areas before the ball goes out to Bobb on the right. He switches possession onto his left foot and looks for Haaland with a cross, but it is headed away.
Mateta is shown his fifth yellow card of the season after a heavy tackle on Bobb.
Eze has netted five goals in eight home games for Palace but hasn’t been able to make an impact today and is coming off for Schlupp.
GOALLL! HAALAND SCORES! 3-1 CITY! That should be game over! City are patient in possession and wait for an opening, with Grealish rolling a reversed pass down the left through to De Bruyne on the byline. The captain then sends a cutback straight to Haaland, who scores from close range.
De Bruyne adds an assist to his goal. He beats the offside trap to get onto Grealish's pass and instinctively finds Haaland in the middle with a fantastic ball into the forward.
Palace came from two goals behind to draw with City earlier in the season, but have struggled to put City under any pressure.
GOALLL! DE BRUYNE SCORES AGAIN! 4-1 CITY! De Bruyne and Grealish play a clever one-two on the left, allowing the England International to get to the byline before cutting the ball back to Rodri. He taps it to De Bruyne, who thunders his low strike into the bottom-left corner.
Rodri spots the run of De Bruyne and plays a simple pass into his feet, allowing the captain to thunder his effort past Henderson. One more goal would see City move to the top of the Premier League.
Palace cannot get out of their own half, with City desperate to score again. Haaland battles past a crowd down the left side of the box and fires it across, but the hosts clear it away.
City are leading comfortably, allowing Rodri to be given a rest ahead of their Champions League tie against Real Madrid. Kovacic replaces him in the midfield.
Mateta scored Palace's opener inside three minutes but has not been able to make any sort of impact in the second half. Edouard takes his place up front.
There is a boost for Palace, with Olise returning from injury. He comes on for Ayew.
Alvarez has had a quiet performance and is now coming off for Nunes.
There is a change at full-back for Palace, with Clyne coming on for Mitchell.
City continue to retain possession and are playing it around with ease. Olise is trying to make an impact but cannot win the ball off the visitors. Foden might have been introduced if the score was closer. However, he might be rested by Guardiola.
Grealish loses possession in his own half, which allows Munoz to win the ball. He bursts down the right, but his pass inside is poor and City clear it away.
OFF THE LINE! Olise pokes the ball away from Akanji inside City's defensive third and rolls a pass into Edouard, who has a clear view of the goal inside the box. His shot deflects off Dias and is heading in, but Stones clears it off the line.
Ahamada hasn’t started for Palace but makes his 25th appearance off the bench, replacing Hughes in the midfield.
Grealish hasn’t registered a goal or an assist for City but will be delighted with his performance on the left side of the attack. He has had 66 touches, won three fouls and combined with De Bruyne brilliantly. He is recently back from injury and will play a huge role for City, who are still in three competitions.
GOALLL! EDOUARD SCORES! Palace get one back, with the hosts trailing 4-2! Ahamada drives through the middle of the pitch before playing a pass down the left to Schlupp, who whips a low cross into the box. Edouard gets in front of his marker and pokes his shot in from close range.
Three Palace substitutes combined for the goal, with Schlupp finding Edouard with a wonderful low cross.
CLOSE! Olise turns onto his left foot on the right and whips a clever cross towards the back post. Schlupp attacks it, but it goes just ahead of him and wide of the left post.
There will be seven minutes of additional time. A Palace goal would put City under serious pressure.
Ahamada does well to collect the ball on the left side of the box, bursting past Kovacic before curling his shot straight at Ortega.
De Bruyne scored twice and registered an assist but is now coming off for Silva. There is some serious depth on the City bench.
Andersen looks to unlock Olise down the right with a long pass forward, but Akanji gets in front of the Palace man and helps City retain possession.
Haaland and Lerma get into an altercation off the ball, with Lerma going down holding his face. There is a VAR check on the incident, but nothing comes of it.
FULL-TIME: CRYSTAL PALACE 2-4 MANCHESTER CITY
De Bruyne scored twice and registered an assist to help City beat Palace 4-2 at Selhurst Park. The Eagles took a shock lead inside three minutes when Mateta showed great composure to fire his low effort off the left post and into the net, but City quickly levelled through De Bruyne, who showed his quality with a thunderous strike into the top-right corner. The Citizens then took control in the second half. Lewis gave them the lead soon after the restart from close range before Haaland got onto the end of De Bruyne's cutback to score from close range. The captain then added his fourth of the contest with a powerful strike from the edge into the bottom-left corner. Edouard got one back for the hosts after coming off the bench, but the Eagles couldn’t mount a late comeback. City are up to second in the Premier League and face Real Madrid in the first leg of their Champions League quarter-final before hosting Luton Town in the top-flight. It doesn’t get much easier for Palace, who travel to Liverpool. That's all for today, goodbye.
summary:
Two second-half goals ended Brentford's nine-match winless run and move further clear of the Premier League relegation zone as they earned a 2-0 victory over rock-bottom Sheffield United.
An Oliver Arblaster own goal off Mikkel Damsgaard’s cross and a stoppage-time finish from Frank Onyeka saw Thomas Frank’s Bees pick up their first victory since February against Chris Wilder’s Blades at the Gtech Community Stadium.
It ends a rough stretch for the hosts, who had struggled since their 2-0 win over Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux on 10 February, and puts further daylight between them and the bottom three – they now have a seven-point cushion.
But woes continue to mount for their visitors, who remain stuck at the foot of the table as they fight to secure their top-flight status.
How the match unfolded 
Both sides spurned opportunities inside the first 15 minutes, with Ben Brereton Diaz unable to fire off a finish after a barnstorming solo break, and Sergio Reguilon drifting a header across the bar from close quarters.
Vitaly Janelt also came near to the opener when he stung the palms of Blades 'keeper Ivo Grbic with an effort from 20 yards out, while Brereton Diaz and Damsgaard both blew chances when they failed to keep their respective strikes low.
Neal Maupay missed the best chance of the first half when a misplaced pass from Anel Ahmedhodzic put him one-on-one on goal, only for the Brentford forward to send his shot wide, while Yoane Wissa could not find a way to break the deadlock either shortly before the interval.
Brentford subsequently thought they had the lead just over nine minutes into the second period when Zanka slotted Mathias Jensen’s dipping free-kick past Grbic inside the box, only for the offside flag to be raised against him.
But the visitors finally cracked at the back when Arblaster stuck a leg out to desperately deal with Damsgaard’s dangerous ball after the Dane had cut loose on a run from midfield, only for the Blades player to divert it into the far corner of the net in the 63rd minute.
Damsgaard thought he had added a second when his smart volley was awarded on-pitch, but referee Sam Barrott overturned the decision after a VAR review that highlighted a foul in the box by Nathan Collins on Oli McBurnie.
Brentford ensured there would be no late fightback when Onyeka darted onto Kevin Schade’s ball from the left flank in the third minute of stoppage time and sent a fine finish past Grbic to seal the deal.
It has not been pleasant viewing for Brentford fans since they returned from the West Midlands with three points just over two months ago, with their side managing only four points in the interim.
Still, victory against their visitors on Saturday ensures they can likely look towards ensuring their Premier League status is preserved for another campaign and Brentford will hope to all but secure safety next weekend when they travel to Luton Town.
Ever since he returned to the club as Paul Heckingbottom’s successor, Chris Wilder has appeared to have the odds stacked against him to ensure Premier League safety for the Yorkshire club.
text:
["Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League clash between Team_8 and Team_13 at Selhurst Park.
Palace started well under new manager Oliver Glasner and beat Team_6 3-0 in his first match in charge, but the Eagles have since failed to win their last four games in the top flight (drawing two and losing two). Their 1-0 loss to Team_3 in their previous outing was particularly frustrating, with Eberechi Eze's potential opener disallowed for offside after a VAR check before Justin Kluivert struck the winner for the Cherries in the 79th minute. However, it would be a stretch to say Palace deserved anything out of the match at the Vitality Stadium after only creating an xG (expected goals) of 0.19 from their three shots. The Eagles are in 14th position in the Premier League and are eight points above the relegation zone with eight games remaining, meaning there is not much to play for, but Glasner will use the final part of the season to see who is in his plans for the next campaign.
City returned to winning ways in their previous match, beating Champions League hopefuls Team_2 4-1 after back-to-back draws with title rivals Team_11 and Team_1.\xa0Jhon Duran\xa0cancelled out Rodri's opener to level the score before Phil Foden netted a stunning hat-trick to extend City's unbeaten run in the top flight to 15 games and keep them within three points of table-toppers Team_11. Pep Guardiola's men will temporarily go above second-place Team_1 with a win. However, they will only move to the summit if they beat Palace by four goals or more. City will be confident of securing a positive result after winning six and drawing two of their last eight Premier League away matches against Palace, and will want to keep spirits high heading into their huge Champions League quarter-final first-leg tie against Real Madrid in Spain next week.
Team_8 (3-4-3): Dean Henderson; Joel Ward, Joachim Andersen, Jefferson Lerma; Daniel Munnoz, Adam Wharton, Will Hughes, Tyrick Mitchell; Eberechi Eze, Jean-Philippe Mateta, Jordan Ayew.
Team_8 SUBS: James Tomkins, Michael Olise, Jeffrey Schlupp, Nathaniel Clyne, Odsonne Edouard, Naouirou Ahamada, Remi Matthews, David Ozoh, Franco Umeh-Chibueze.
Team_13 (4-1-4-1): Stefan Ortega; Rico Lewis, John Stones, Ruben Dias, Josko Gvardiol; Rodri; Oscar Bobb, Kevin De Bruyne, Julian Alvarez, Jack Grealish; Erling Haaland.
Team_13 SUBS: Mateo Kovacic, Jeremy Doku, Bernardo Silva, Sergio Gomez, Manuel Akanji, Matheus Nunes, Ederson, Phil Foden, Mahamadou Susoho.
Palace name the same side that started their 1-0 loss to Team_3 in their previous Premier League outing. However, Olise returns to the bench after missing the last seven matches through injury.
City make four alterations to the team that beat Villa 4-1 in their previous match. Despite scoring a hat-trick against the Lions, Foden drops onto the bench and is replaced by De Bruyne, who captains the side. Stones comes in for Akanji at centre-back, and Bobb is picked ahead of Doku on the right. Haaland appears up front and is in the side instead of Silva, meaning Alvarez drops further back. Ederson returns to the squad after getting injured against Team_11 last month, allowing Ortega to start again.
Palace came from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 with City in the reverse fixture in December. Only in 1992-93, 1994-95, and 2021-22 have they avoided defeat in both Premier League meetings with the Citizens in a season. Both teams are on the pitch and are ready to get started.
Palace get this Premier League clash under way. The two teams switched sides before the start.
It will be interesting to see if Palace have a strong start, with the Eagles playing at home with an unchanged side and an extra day of rest compared to City. The visitors might look to build their way into the contest after making four switches. However, it is tough to disagree with Guardiola, who has led his side to a 25-match unbeaten run in all competitions. Haaland is back, but if the Citizens take a healthy lead, he will probably come off early with a huge Champions League tie against Madrid soon.
Bobb wins possession off Eze and helps City break forward quickly down the right side of Palace's half, with De Bruyne winning an early corner. The Belgium international looks for Haaland in the middle, but Andersen heads it clear.
GOALLLL!\xa0MATETA SCORES! 1-0 PALACE! What a start for the Eagles! Stones gifts possession to the hosts, who play some quick passes in their own half before\xa0Wharton rolls a throughball into Mateta. The striker races down the right side of the box before directing his low shot across the goal and into the net off the left post.
That’s a brilliant pass from Wharton, who finds the run of Mateta. He still has plenty to do but shows great composure to beat Ortega.
Palace had failed to score in any of their last four Premier League home games against City, with Luka Milivojevic in April 2019 the last Eagles player to score against them at Selhurst Park.
WIDE! Huge chance for City to level!\xa0De Bruyne has possession on the right and whips a fantastic delivery into the box. Gvardiol stays up from a previous corner and attempts to direct a header on target, but puts his shot wide of the right post.
Palace have another chance to break forward with speed, but\xa0Wharton's pass down the left to Eze is wayward of the winger. However, he collects it well and tries to play a one-two with Ayew, who sends the ball out for a goal-kick.
POST! City go close this time! Bobb and Lewis combine on the right before the latter of the pair slides a brilliant pass through to Alvarez, who bursts into the box. The Argentine then drives a low strike across the goal, but it hits the left post before Henderson punches it away.
SAVE! What a stop from Henderson to keep Palace ahead! A cross into the Eagles box is headed away by Lerma as far as Rodri, who directs a first-time effort from just inside the box towards the bottom-right corner. It looks to be heading into the net, but Henderson gets down well to push it around the post.
GOALLLL! WHAT A HIT FROM\xa0DE BRUYNE! 1-1!\xa0Grealish gets his first chance to dribble at Munoz down the left before his low cross is blocked. However, it rebounds straight to De Bruyne, who switches possession onto his right foot inside the box before curling his perfect strike into the top-right corner.
City have scored 29 first-half goals in 31 games, only Team_1 (33) and Villa (31) have scored more in the Premier League this season. Henderson made a top save to deny Rodri earlier, but that goal from De Bruyne was simply unstoppable.
City have controlled possession so far and have had 87.1 per cent of the ball. Mateta scored the opener for the Eagles, but he is the only player in a home shirt who is staying forward and looks isolated. Any early nerves for Guardiola are probably gone.
OVER! Mitchell lofts a cross into the box from the left, with Ortega getting there before Mateta to punch it away. It drops to Ayew on the edge, but he lashes his effort well over the bar.
ANOTHER SAVE! Henderson is keeping Palace in the contest. De Bruyne spins on the ball just inside the Eagles' half and slides a wonderful throughball into the path of Haaland, who is one-on-one with the goalkeeper. However, Henderson comes out quickly to block his strike.
De Bruyne is appearing all over the pitch, this time getting down the left to get on the end of Grealish's pass down the wing. The captain races towards the byline before his low cross is blocked.
Munoz slides into Grealish, who stays down and looks hurt. It’s a worrying moment for City after Grealish's injury record this season, but he is back on his feet without needing medical treatment.
City have a good spell of possession before Dias breaks their short passing routine with a fantastic switch from left to right over to Bobb. He is in space inside the Palace box, but the ball hits his arm and a free-kick is given. Bobb looks frustrated with himself.
City continue to control the possession, with Palace packing their defensive third to stop the visitors from progressing. Rodri then attempts to chip a pass forward to Alvarez, but Mitchell matches his run to head it away.
Grealish wins a corner off Ward on the right, with the Palace defender heading De Bruyne's first corner behind before then clearing the next one from the same side well away. Two poor deliveries from De Bruyne, which is a surprise due to his quality. There hasn’t been a shot for over 10 minutes.
Gvardiol strolls out of the defence, arriving at the edge of the Palace box before seeing his shot blocked at close range. The Croatian defender and Stones are getting further forward to help increase the City pressure.
Palace are sitting deep, meaning that anytime they win possession or put in a strong tackle, they struggle to keep the ball. Rodri attempts to slide a clever pass down the right side of the box to Haaland, but Mitchell is strong and gets a foot across to poke the ball behind for a corner.
WIDE! Alvarez has time and space just to the right outside Palace’s box, but he fires his effort across the goal and wide of the left post.
De Bruyne shows his invention with a wonderful chipped pass over the Palace defence and down the right side of the box to Bobb, who is in plenty of space. However, he doesn’t race towards the spinning ball. As a result, when it hit the floor, it bounced straight out for a goal-kick. Bobb puts his arms in the air as he realises that it was his fault.
A rare Palace attack, with Mateta getting to the ball before Rodri down the right, and curling a low cross into the box. However, it is too close to Ortega, who collects it well.
BAR! What a chance for Palace to take the lead again! Rodri loses possession in City's half, and Ayew races forward before firing his right-footed effort against the top of the bar!
City have lost control in the last couple of minutes and haven’t been as relaxed in possession. Lewis has a shot on the edge of Palace's box but blasts his effort straight at Henderson.
CHANCE! Munoz breaks down the right for Palace and cuts the ball back to the edge of the box to Ayew, but his touch is very poor. Hughes collects it but is tackled by Rodri, who sends a blind pass back to Ortega. Mateta puts the goalkeeper under pressure. However, the City man turns away from the Frenchman. Ederson would be proud of that one!
Haaland has been involved in seven goals in his last six away appearances for City in the Premier League, scoring four and assisting three. However, he’s not scored in any of his previous four such games, his longest run without a goal on the road in the competition. He has only had seven touches so far!
There will be three minutes of additional time.
Gvardiol thunders into Ayew's back and gives away a free-kick just inside City's half. He then shows his frustrations to the referee, who gives him a yellow card for dissent.
HALF-TIME: Team_8 1-1 Team_13
