Havertz then made the points safe in the latter stages, firing home after Nketiah's clever throughball had played him in to put the result beyond doubt. The win moves Team_1 top, temporarily at least ahead of Team_11 game with Team_14 at Anfield later on Sunday. For Team_5, this loss and Team_19 win against Team_20 means they drop to ninth. They will look to get back on track away at Team_8 on Thursday, while the Gunners will look to land a huge blow in the title race when they take on Team_11 at Anfield on Saturday. That is all we have from the Emirates Stadium, so thanks for your company and goodbye!"]
label: Normal

events:
Hello everyone and welcome to live text coverage of the Premier League clash between West Ham and Manchester City.
The London Stadium plays host to two sides protecting unbeaten starts to the Premier League season. Man City have won all four of their matches, while West Ham have won three and drawn one of their four games so far.
WEST HAM (4-1-4-1): Alphonse Areola; Vladimir Coufal, Kurt Zouma, Nayef Aguerd, Emerson; Edson Alvarez; Jarrod Bowen, Tomas Soucek, James Ward-Prowse, Lucas Paqueta; Michail Antonio.
SUBS: Lukasz Fabianski, Aaron Cresswell, Pablo Fornals, Mohammed Kudus, Konstantinos Mavropanos, Danny Ings, Angelo Ogbonna, Said Benrahma, Thilo Kehrer.
MANCHESTER CITY (4-2-3-1): Ederson; Kyle Walker, Manuel Akanji, Ruben Dias, Josko Gvardiol; Rodri, Phil Foden; Bernardo Silva, Julian Alvarez, Jeremy Doku; Erling Haaland.
SUBS: Stefan Ortega, Scott Carson, Kalvin Phillips, Nathan Ake, Sergio Gomez, Matheus Nunes, Oscar Bobb, Rico Lewis.
David Moyes makes a single change from West Ham's win over Luton Town last time out. Soucek is back after concussion to replace Benrahma, who drops to the bench, while Ward-Prowse and Coufal also start. Mavropanos could make his debut as a substitute.
Meanwhile, Pep Guardiola makes two changes from the win over Fulham. Gvardiol and Silva are in for Ake and Kovacic, who joins Kevin De Bruyne, John Stones and Jack Grealish in the treatment room. New signing Nunes could make his debut from the bench.
City are unbeaten in their last 15 Premier League meetings with West Ham. The Hammers' only longer streak without victory was a 16-match spell against Manchester United between 1993 and 2001.
The teams make their way out onto the pitch and kick-off is fast approaching at the London Stadium.
The referee blows his whistle and City get us under way.
The reigning champions go straight onto the attack with some neat link-up play down the right. Walker finds Foden, who centres the ball, but it ricochets kindly into Areola's arms.
Good defending! Walker shows great vision to pick out Haaland, who looks to slip the ball through for Foden. But Coufal tracks his run well and makes an important sliding intervention.
City continue to ask questions of the West Ham defence. Doku gets away from Coufal and crosses, but Zouma is well-placed to head clear.
GREAT SAVES! Areola twice comes to West Ham's rescue! Foden's corner finds Rodri, whose powerful header is beaten away by Areola. A follow-up shot from Haaland is then cleared off the line, before the goalkeeper denies Dias from point-blank range.
West Ham did well to somehow survive that City corner. The hosts have Areola to thank, but Soucek was also alert in clearing off the line.
The Hammers are enjoying their joint-best start to a Premier League season, having also collected 10 points from their opening four games under Harry Redknapp back in 1999-2000.
It is great to see Guardiola back on the City bench today after his recent back operation. The Spaniard has never lost against West Ham in the Premier League.
HAALAND MISSES! He is human, you know! Doku teases defenders before slipping the ball through for Gvardiol, who drills it across the face of goal. Haaland is unmarked at the far post, but can only steer the ball wide from inside the six-yard box.
AGUERD SHOULD SCORE! West Ham force their first corner of the game. Bowen's delivery is flicked on at the near post by Soucek, but Aguerd cannot react quickly enough to apply the finishing touch in the six-yard box.
Doku has been lively so far. Receiving a diagonal ball from Akanji, he teases Coufal once more. The winger then goes for goal from a tight angle, but his shot is straight at Areola.
West Ham have conceded two or more goals in nine of their last 10 Premier League matches against the reigning champions. But the hosts have maintained their concentration levels so far to keep City at bay.
Foden receives the ball on the edge of the box and gets a shot away, but Zouma is well-placed to deflect it wide for a corner.
City are unbeaten in eight Premier League away games against West Ham, scoring 24 goals along the way and conceding just six.
West Ham threaten and Antonio is found, but Akanji shows great strength to dispossess the Hammers forward.
Sarcastic cheers echo around the London Stadium as Foden's attempted corner curls out of play. West Ham can relax for a moment with a goal-kick.
Rodri skips away from Edson Alvarez and shoots from the edge of the box. It is a clean strike, but straight at Areola.
City have dominated proceedings so far with over 70 per cent of the possession. But the visitors are still in search of the breakthrough.
There is a break in play as Antonio and Dias stay down following an aerial collision. But after taking a moment to gather themselves, both players are soon back on their feet.
Moyes does not boast a great record against City in recent times. The Scot claimed 40 of a possible 66 Premier League points from the Citizens during his time at Everton, but has won just two from 39 since then.
WARD-PROWSE!!! 1-0 WEST HAM! The hosts lead against the run of play! West Ham quickly break as Coufal exchanges passes with Bowen and gets away down the right. The full-back then provides a brilliant cross to the far post, where the unmarked Ward-Prowse buries a header.
Dispossessing Doku, Coufal burst into the action with a neat one-two with Bowen, before his delicious cross was headed home by Ward-Prowse.
Opening the scoring, Ward-Prowse has now been directly involved in a goal in each of his last six Premier League appearances. That is his best such streak in the English top flight.
Edson Alvarez throws the ball away to prevent City from taking a quick free-kick, and is booked.
There is a long way to go yet at the London Stadium. But as things stand, West Ham would leapfrog City to second place in the Premier League table.
OFF THE LINE! West Ham somehow survive! Once again, Doku teases Coufal and sends a low cross towards the far post. Haaland is unmarked and turns the ball towards goal, but Aguerd is alert to prevent it from creeping over the line.
City continue to seek the equaliser. Rodri lets fly from distance with a fierce effort that whistles fractionally wide of the target.
We are into the first of two additional minutes at the end of this first half. The visitors keep threatening, but West Ham remain stubborn.
Gvardiol catches Bowen late and has his name taken.
HALF-TIME: WEST HAM 1-0 MANCHESTER CITY
West Ham lead Manchester City 1-0 at the break. Although on the back foot for most of the first half, the Hammers broke the deadlock in the 36th minute with James Ward-Prowse heading home Vladimir Coufal's cross to continue his rich vein of form.
City trail at the London Stadium despite enjoying 64.1 per cent of the possession during the first half, while also registering 17 shots on goal to their opponents' three.
We are off and running again at the London Stadium.
DOKU!!! 1-1! CITY ARE LEVEL! After a brilliant first half, Doku makes a superb start to the second. Found by Julian Alvarez, he cuts inside and into the area before sweeping the ball into the far corner.
Julian Alvarez marauded forward into the West Ham half and played the ball out to Doku, who did the rest in sublime fashion.
What a start to the second half by City! The words of Guardiola are clearly still ringing in their ears. They are looking incredibly purposeful here.
City force a corner after Foden's shot deflects wide. The subsequent delivery eventually drops to Gvardiol, who cannot keep his volley down.
The visitors have a free-kick in a dangerous position after Edson Alvarez upends Rodri. This is a decent opportunity to turn the contest on its head.
OFF THE POST! The woodwork denies City! Julian Alvarez steps up and whips a wonderful effort towards the near corner, only to see his attempt crash against the post.
WHAT A SAVE! Areola denies Haaland! Rodri intercepts possession and drives forward before scooping the ball over the top of the defence for Haaland, whose acrobatic volley is beaten away by Areola.
Still, the goal eludes Haaland today. City's number nine has now had six shots on goal - more than any other player - without success. But he will continue to plug away.
West Ham turn defence into attack with Paqueta sending Antonio on his way. However, the latter's touch is too heavy and Ederson is quickly out to deny him.
City attack down the other end and Rodri tries his luck from distance. But his left-footed effort is high and wide of the target.
CHANCE! Silva whips a delicious ball into the box. Haaland attacks it, but can only head straight at Areola.
Great challenge! Emerson leads West Ham's charge with a powerful run into the heart of the City defence. But Akanji denies him a shot on goal with a brilliantly timed sliding tackle.
GOOD SAVE! Ward-Prowse's corner is met by Zouma, whose powerful header is well kept out by Ederson.
This is a thoroughly entertaining contest at the London Stadium. Both sides are providing plenty of attacking threat as they go in search of the game's third goal.
GOOD SAVE! Space opens for Gvardiol to let fly from distance. The full-back's effort takes a slight deflection, but Areola tracks the ball well and pushes it away.
Moyes is going to make a change. Kudus is introduced for the hosts with Antonio making way.
City make a change as well. Nunes comes on for his debut in place of Foden.
Benrahma also replaces Edson Alvarez, who is unable to continue after picking up a knock.
We are approaching the final 20 minutes at the London Stadium. Can either side find a winning goal, or are we set for a stalemate?
West Ham last beat City in the Premier League in September 2015. The Hammers have every chance of ending that wait here, but must maintain their performance levels.
The Hammers look to threaten down the left flank with Benrahma leading the charge. But Walker tracks him all the way and eventually snuffs out the danger.
SILVA!!! 2-1 CITY! The turnaround is complete! After Nunes' cross is cleared, City maintain the pressure. Silva latches onto Julian Alvarez's scooped pass, before clipping the ball beyond Areola.
Julian Alvarez provided the assist with a delightful lofted ball over the top of the West Ham defence.
The reigning champions hit the front at the London Stadium. It has been quite a battle for Guardiola's side today, but they have eventually edged their noses ahead.
Soucek is late on Akanji and goes into the book.
GREAT SAVE! Walker demonstrates his incredible pace as he beats Zouma to Silva's clever pass and bursts away down the right. He crosses for Haaland, but Areola once again denies City's number nine with tremendous reflexes.
That is now eight shots without success today for Haaland, though Areola has been in wonderful form to keep him at bay. He will keep trying, though.
HAALAND!!! 3-1 CITY! Haaland gets his goal! Silva is found by Julian Alvarez in acres of space on the right. The winger comes inside and picks out Haaland, who takes a touch before drilling past Areola.
Silva was afforded far too much space to come in from the right wing and pick out Haaland.
West Ham make two changes. One of them sees Kehrer replace Coufal.
Ings is also introduced by Moyes with Soucek making way.
If at first you don't succeed, try, try and try again! That has certainly been the case for Haaland, whose patience and persistence eventually pays dividends.
Rodri goes into the book for tripping Kudus.
Doku is given a well-earned rest as he goes off to be replaced by Gomez.
We are into the first of six additional minutes at the end of this game.
City in complete control as the clock ticks down towards what should be a fifth straight victory. The visitors neatly knock the ball around and maintain possession.
The visitors make a triple-change. Haaland is given a breather with Lewis coming on.
Gvardiol also makes way for City, with Ake on for the final moments.
The last of the changes sees Bobb replace Silva.
Paqueta has his name taken for a trip on Bobb.
FULL-TIME: WEST HAM 1-3 MANCHESTER CITY
Manchester City stay perfect and return to the top of the Premier League table after coming from behind to beat West Ham 3-1. The hosts took a first-half lead at the London Stadium through James Ward-Prowse's header. But the visitors responded as Jeremy Doku levelled within 60 seconds of the restart. Bernardo Silva then completed the turnaround in the 76th minute, before Erling Haaland sealed the points four minutes from time.
Both sides are in European action against Serbian opposition in midweek. City launch their Champions League title defence against Red Star Belgrade on Tuesday, while West Ham begin their Europa League campaign against Backa Topola two days later.
That's all for today. Thank you for joining us. Until next time, goodbye!
summary:
Mykhailo Mudryk's first goal for Chelsea and an Armando Broja strike in the space of 82 seconds helped secure a 2-0 victory at Fulham for the Blues' first away win of the season.
Broja, starting his first Premier League match since last November, missed a glorious chance to give Chelsea a second-minute lead.
The striker capitalised on a defensive mix-up before rounding Bernd Leno, but with only a few defenders on the line, Broja sent his effort high and wide.
That miss did not prove costly, though, as Chelsea took the lead on 18 minutes through Mudryk, who controlled Levi Colwill's pass over the top of Fulham's defence before sliding the ball through Leno's legs for his first goal for the club.
And less than two minutes later, Broja doubled Chelsea's lead.
From the kick-off, Fulham played the ball back to Tim Ream, whose pass was intercepted by Cole Palmer. The winger, making his first Premier League start for the club, then fed the ball into Broja, and despite Ream's attempted recovery clearance, the ball deflected off Broja and into the net.
The visitors nearly put the contest to bed just after the hour-mark when substitute Ian Maatsen struck a post, with the resulting effort from Enzo Fernandez being saved by Leno.
Fulham did have a great chance to reduce the deficit through substitute Sasa Lukic, but he could only shoot straight at Robert Sanchez from six yards out.
It was a deserved victory for Mauricio Pochettino's side as Chelsea move up to 11th on eight points, ahead of 13th-placed Fulham on goal difference.
Fulham report | Chelsea report
Marco Silva: "At this level and against these types of teams, we cannot make mistakes. We were punished by the mistakes that we made. We had all the conditions to avoid that type of situation [two goals in 82 seconds]. First goal is soft, and of course, the second goal, the way we lost the ball, even our reaction - we should react much stronger. It took the confidence from us; our first half was not at a good level at all." 
Mauricio Pochettino: "It was important for us to build our confidence and our trust in ourselves. The performances have been very good but we didn't translate that to results; we did today, we got what we deserved. It's always important for offensive players to score goals, [Mudryk] has been doing well but unfortunately he felt something in his quad at half-time; for Broja to score too after a long time out. We need to make people believe, but when everyone is fit we are going to be so competitive."
Referee: Tim Robinson. Assistants: Stuart Burt, Eddie Smart. Fourth official: Simon Hooper. VAR: John Brooks. Assistant VAR: Mark Scholes.

events:
Hello everyone and welcome to live text coverage of the Premier League match between Nottingham Forest and Sheffield United.
Both teams are seeking their first points of the season after suffering defeats on the opening weekend. Forest went down 2-1 at Arsenal while United were beaten 1-0 at home by Crystal Palace.
NOTTINGHAM FOREST (3-4-3): Matt Turner; Willy Boly, Joe Worrall, Scott McKenna; Serge Aurier, Danilo, Orel Mangala, Neco Williams; Brennan Johnson, Taiwo Awoniyi, Morgan Gibbs-White.
SUBS: Ethan Horvath, Cheikhou Kouyate, Chris Wood, Harry Toffolo, Moussa Niakhite, Anthony Elanga, Ryan Yates, Remo Freuler, Hwang Ui-Jo.
SHEFFIELD UNITED (3-5-2): Wes Foderingham; Anel Ahemdhodzic, John Egan, Jack Robinson; Ben Osborn, Gustavo Hamer, Oliver Norwood, Vinicius, Max Lowe; Benie Traore, William Osula.
SUBS: Adam Davies, Auston Trusty, Chris Basham, Tom Davies, Yasser Larouci, Louie Marsh, Andre Brooks, Femi Seriki, Antwoine Hackford.
Steve Cooper makes two changes from the defeat at Arsenal. Awoniyi is recalled to the starting XI after scoring from the bench at the Emirates, while Williams is also brought in with Aina and Yates dropping to the bench. Niakhite is also named among the substitutes after recovering from an elbow injury. Omar Richards, Felipe and Wayne Hennessey are long-term absentees.
Paul Heckingbottom also makes a couple of alterations from the opening weekend. Hamer makes his debut after signing from Coventry City with Vinicius also brought into the starting XI. Basham drops to the bench while Baldock misses out through injury. He joins a lengthy list of absentees including Oli McBurnie, John Fleck, Rhys Norrington-Davies, Jayden Bogle, Rhian Brewster, Daniel Jebbison and Ismaila Coulibaly.
This is the first Premier League meeting between the sides since May 1993. United won 2-0 at the City Ground that day to relegate Brian Clough's Forest from the top flight.
The players are making their way out onto the field and kick-off is just moments away.
The referee blows his whistle and the match is under way.
AWONIYI!!! 1-0 FOREST! The hosts make their positive start tell! Following a patient build-up, the ball is laid back to Aurier, whose cross is powered home by the head of Awoniyi.
Aurier floated a delicious ball into the box for Awoniyi to attack.
Awoniyi becomes the first Forest player to score in six successive Premier League games since Stan Collymore in 1995.
United look to respond immediately and force a corner. However, it comes to nothing as Forest defend well.
It has been an exciting opening to the game at the City Ground. Forest turned a purposeful start into the first goal of the contest, delighting the home crowd.
Forest have only lost once in their last 13 home league games against United. That sole defeat came back in December 2008.
The hosts were strong on home soil last season, losing just five of their 19 Premier League games here.
Good try! Forest counter with Awoniyi feeding Gibbs-White, who gets a shot away from the edge of the box, but Foderingham gets down to it.
United are trying to generate a threat on the Forest goal, but are unable to find a way through their stubborn hosts at the moment.
Forest push in search of a second goal and are awarded a corner. But it comes to nothing as United deal with the delivery.
The visitors look to get in behind the Forest defence, but the hosts just about manage to scramble the ball away.
Slowly but surely, United are beginning to gain a foothold in this contest. Although, they are still to register their first shot on goal.
The Blades have failed to win their first away league game in each of the last 11 seasons stretching back to a 2-0 win over Oldham Athletic in 2011-12.
Williams appeals for a penalty after taking a tumble in the box, but the referee is not interested.
Forest continue to threaten down the left flank, but Foderingham rises to collect a ball into the box.
Johnson cuts in from the right and unleashes a shot that deflects behind for a corner. Can the hosts capitalise?
CHANCE! Boly is unmarked as he meets Gibbs-White's corner delivery, but he is unable to keep his header down.
Good effort! United register their first shot following an attack down the right. Danilo clears but only as far as Vinicius, whose curling 25-yard strike is pushed away by Turner.
Boly drags Traore down and receives the first yellow card of the game.
The Blades enjoy a positive spell and almost get in behind the Forest defence, who manage to deflect a dangerous low ball behind for a corner.
A nervy moment for Foderingham, who races out of goal but is beaten to the ball by Gibbs-White. Thankfully for the visitors, they have cover and the ball ricochets kindly for Foderingham to eventually tidy up.
A break in play here with Johnson in need of attention. The Forest forward stayed down shortly after seeing his shot blocked from just outside the box.
After receiving attention from the medical team, Johnson is soon back on his feet and returns to the thick of the action.
Aurier demonstrates his frustration towards the referee, who wanted a word with the Forest wing-back. But he goes a bit too far and has his name taken.
Gibbs-White shows clever footwork to get out of a tight situation and race towards the United defence. But his eventual shot is a poor one that goes high into the stands.
We are into the first of two additional minutes at the end of this first half.
Norwood is the latest player to go into the referee's notebook.
HALF-TIME: NOTTINGHAM FOREST 1-0 SHEFFIELD UNITED
Nottingham Forest lead Sheffield United by a goal to nil at the break. Taiwo Awoniyi's third-minute header separates the sides at the City Ground. The goal came after a hugely positive start to the contest from the hosts, who are certainly good value for their half-time lead.
Although they started slowly, United grew into the contest and ended up enjoying more possession during the first half. However, they only registered a single shot on target - something they must improve after the break.
The visitors make a change at the break with Larouci replacing Lowe.
Off we go again! Forest get the ball rolling once more.
HAMER!!! 1-1! What a strike! And what a start to the second half by the visitors! United make a positive start to the second half and force a corner that is only cleared as far as Hamer, who sets himself before bending a stunning 20-yard strike into the top corner.
That was a debut goal to remember for Hamer. Straight into the team following his move from Coventry, he has wasted no time in making his mark.
Close! The visitors almost turn things around with the ball breaking kindly for Vinicius. He goes for placement 20 yards from goal, but his precise effort is just wide of the target.
The Blades have won just three of their last 29 away games in the Premier League, losing 22 of those. But they are well in with a shout here.
OFFSIDE! Forest think they have regained the lead as Awoniyi gets in behind and neatly lifts the ball into the net. However, his joy is short-lived when the offside flag is rightly raised.
Vinicius is unable to continue after picking up an earlier knock. He is replaced by Basham.
We are still level as we hit the hour mark at the City Ground. Will it remain this way, or will one of the teams take the spoils?
Danilo tries his luck from distance. But his ambitious attempt is high, wide and never troubling the goal.
Forest have a faint appeal for a penalty, but the referee is not interested and, instead, the hosts can threaten from a corner.
GOOD SAVE! Danger for the visitors as the ball ricochets kindly for Forest inside the penalty box. Aurier and Boly get shots away, but Foderingham shows great reflexes to deny the latter.
A positive spell for Forest, who are aiming to record four successive Premier League home wins for the first time since January 1996.
Forest make a double-change. The first sees Yates replace Mangala.
Elanga also enters the action with Boly making way.
Forest build up the pressure down the right flank. The ball falls kindly for Danilo on the edge of the box, but his tame effort is blocked.
Hamer is booked for a foul on Gibbs-White.
A change for the visitors with Osula replaced by Brooks.
The Blades have not recorded a draw in any of their last 25 Premier League outings. As things stand, that streak will end here.
A nervy moment for Forest as Turner is unable to gather the ball under pressure. But the goalkeeper was fouled and the referee penalises the visitors.
CHANCE! Forest are almost a punished for a real defensive mix-up! McKenna and Worrall get in each other's way as they go for the same ball, enabling Traore to race away. However, Turner comes to the hosts' rescue with fine reflexes to deny the United forward.
The hosts will know they got away with one there. A real lack of communication between their defenders was almost punished, and could have cost them the game.
Traore is unable to continue and goes off to be replaced by Hackford.
Awoniyi is given a breather. He is replaced by Wood for the final six minutes.
Osborn takes a little too long taking a throw-in and is booked for time-wasting.
We are into the final two minutes of regulation time. Can either side find a winner in these latter stages?
WOOD!!! 2-1 FOREST! The hosts may have just won it! After a corner is cleared, Worrall keeps the danger alive, finding Aurier on the wing. In plenty of space, the latter sets himself and delivers a delicious cross that is brilliantly guided in by Wood.
Aurier gets his second assist of the game with another lovely cross that was begging to be attacked.
As we enter the first of eight additional minutes, Kouyate replaces Danilo in the first of two more Forest changes.
Niakhite also comes on with Johnson given a breather.
What an impact by Wood! Introduced for Awoniyi, he took just five minutes to make a significant impact - one that could have earned his team all three points.
Chance! The hosts are very much in control of proceedings as the clock ticks down. The ball is fizzed across the box towards Elanga, but the ball ricochets against him and over the bar.
Just 60 seconds remain and United have the ball, but they need to get it forward and into the Forest penalty area.
The ball is swung into the Forest box, but after receiving a timely shout from a team-mate, Aurier lets it run behind for a goal kick. The hosts are almost there.
FULL-TIME: NOTTINGHAM FOREST 2-1 SHEFFIELD UNITED
Chris Wood was the hero as his late header secured Nottingham Forest's first points of the Premier League season. The substitute headed the winner in the 89th minute after Gustavo Hamer's debut goal cancelled out Taiwo Awoniyi's early header. Despite a spirited effort at the City Ground, Sheffield United remain pointless after their opening two games.
Both sides are back in action next weekend. Forest look to build on their momentum when they travel to Old Trafford to face Manchester United. Meanwhile, Sheffield United look to get their first points on the board when they entertain reigning champions Manchester City.
That's all. Thank you for following our live coverage. Until next time, goodbye!
summary: Referee: Simon Hooper. Assistants: Adrian Holmes, Simon Long. Fourth official: Tony Harrington. VAR: Darren England. Assistant VAR: Timothy Wood.
text:
["Hello everyone and welcome to live text coverage of the Premier League match between Team_16 and Team_17.
Both teams are seeking their first points of the season after suffering defeats on the opening weekend. Forest went down 2-1 at Team_1 while United were beaten 1-0 at home by Team_8.
Team_16 (3-4-3): Matt Turner; Willy Boly, Joe Worrall, Scott McKenna; Serge Aurier, Danilo, Orel Mangala, Neco Williams; Brennan Johnson, Taiwo Awoniyi, Morgan Gibbs-White.
SUBS: Ethan Horvath, Cheikhou Kouyate, Chris Wood, Harry Toffolo, Moussa Niakhite, Anthony Elanga, Ryan Yates, Remo Freuler, Hwang Ui-Jo.
Team_17 (3-5-2): Wes Foderingham; Anel Ahemdhodzic, John Egan, Jack Robinson; Ben Osborn, Gustavo Hamer, Oliver Norwood, Vinicius, Max Lowe; Benie Traore, William Osula.
SUBS: Adam Davies, Auston Trusty, Chris Basham, Tom Davies, Yasser Larouci, Louie Marsh, Andre Brooks, Femi Seriki, Antwoine Hackford.
Steve Cooper makes two changes from the defeat at Team_1. Awoniyi is recalled to the starting XI after scoring from the bench at the Emirates, while Williams is also brought in with Aina and Yates dropping to the bench. Niakhite is also named among the substitutes after recovering from an elbow injury. Omar Richards, Felipe and Wayne Hennessey are long-term absentees.
Paul Heckingbottom also makes a couple of alterations from the opening weekend. Hamer makes his debut after signing from Coventry City with Vinicius also brought into the starting XI. Basham drops to the bench while Baldock misses out through injury. He joins a lengthy list of absentees including Oli McBurnie, John Fleck, Rhys Norrington-Davies, Jayden Bogle, Rhian Brewster, Daniel Jebbison and Ismaila Coulibaly.
This is the first Premier League meeting between the sides since May 1993. United won 2-0 at the City Ground that day to relegate Brian Clough's Forest from the top flight.
The players are making their way out onto the field and kick-off is just moments away.
The referee blows his whistle and the match is under way.
AWONIYI!!! 1-0 FOREST! The hosts make their positive start tell! Following a patient build-up, the ball is laid back to Aurier, whose cross is powered home by the head of Awoniyi.
Aurier floated a delicious ball into the box for Awoniyi to attack.
Awoniyi becomes the first Forest player to score in six successive Premier League games since Stan Collymore in 1995.
United look to respond immediately and force a corner. However, it comes to nothing as Forest defend well.
It has been an exciting opening to the game at the City Ground. Forest turned a purposeful start into the first goal of the contest, delighting the home crowd.
Forest have only lost once in their last 13 home league games against United. That sole defeat came back in December 2008.
The hosts were strong on home soil last season, losing just five of their 19 Premier League games here.
Good try! Forest counter with Awoniyi feeding Gibbs-White, who gets a shot away from the edge of the box, but Foderingham gets down to it.
United are trying to generate a threat on the Forest goal, but are unable to find a way through their stubborn hosts at the moment.
Forest push in search of a second goal and are awarded a corner. But it comes to nothing as United deal with the delivery.
The visitors look to get in behind the Forest defence, but the hosts just about manage to scramble the ball away.
Slowly but surely, United are beginning to gain a foothold in this contest. Although, they are still to register their first shot on goal.
The Blades have failed to win their first away league game in each of the last 11 seasons stretching back to a 2-0 win over Oldham Athletic in 2011-12.

Forest continue to threaten down the left flank, but Foderingham rises to collect a ball into the box.

Boly drags Traore down and receives the first yellow card of the game.

We are into the first of two additional minutes at the end of this first half.
Norwood is the latest player to go into the referee's notebook.

Both sides are back in action next weekend. Forest look to build on their momentum when they travel to Old Trafford to face Team_14. Meanwhile, Team_17 look to get their first points on the board when they entertain reigning champions Team_13.
That's all. Thank you for following our live coverage. Until next time, goodbye!"]

events:
Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League clash between Newcastle United and Luton Town at St. James' Park.
Newcastle ended a four-match losing run in the Premier League with a 3-1 win over Aston Villa in their last outing. The Villans had won 16 of their previous 17 games at home in the top flight, but a brace from Fabian Schar and an own goal from Alex Moreno helped the Magpies to a comfortable three-goal lead before Ollie Watkins netted a consolation. A third straight-away victory in all competitions lifted Eddie Howe's men into eighth position. Newcastle are 14 points behind fourth-placed Tottenham, meaning their chances of qualifying for the Champions League for the second successive season is very unlikely. However, they will still be hoping that a place in the Europa League or Europa Conference League is in their grasp. Despite this, the Magpies must improve their form at St. James' Park, with the hosts losing back-to-back fixtures against Nottingham Forest and Manchester City.
Luton are in good form in the Premier League and have won three of their last five matches to take themselves out of the relegation zone and into 17th position. Securing two consecutive triumphs over Newcastle and Sheffield United at the start of the run, the Hatters lost 3-2 to Chelsea before collecting a point against Burnley. However, Rob Edwards' men returned to winning ways with their most emphatic win of the season in their previous match, with a hat-trick from Elijah Adebayo and a goal from Chiedozie Ogbene helping them secure a 4-0 win over European hopefuls Brighton. It was a special victory for Luton, with captain Tom Lockyer making his first appearance at Kenilworth Road since suffering a cardiac arrest in December's game at Bournemouth. The visitors will now be looking to complete a famous double over Newcastle for the first time since the 1937-38 campaign.
NEWCASTLE UNITED (4-3-3): Martin Dubravka; Kieran Trippier, Fabian Schar, Sven Botman, Dan Burn; Sean Longstaff, Bruno Guimaraes, Lewis Miley; Miguel Almiron, Jacob Murphy, Anthony Gordon.
NEWCASTLE UNITED SUBS: Paul Dummett, Callum Wilson, Matt Ritchie, Harvey Barnes, Emil Krafth, Loris Karius, Lewis Hall, Tino Livramento, Joe White.
LUTON TOWN (3-4-2-1): Thomas Kaminski; Teden Mengi, Gabriel Osho, Amari'i Bell; Chiedozie Ogbene, Albert Sambi Lokonga, Ross Barkley, Alfie Doughty; Jordan Clark, Elijah Adebayo; Carlton Morris.
LUTON TOWN SUBS: Luke Berry, Cauley Woodrow, Issa Kabore, Tahith Chong, Reece Burke, Pelly Ruddock Mpanzu, Jacob Brown, Tim Krul, Andros Townsend.
Newcastle make one enforced change to the side that beat Villa 3-1 in their last Premier League outing. Alexander Isak went off with a groin injury and is replaced in the attack by Almiron. However, there is a double boost for the injury-hit Magpies, with Barnes and Wilson back on the bench after a spell on the sidelines.
Luton make one alteration to the team that thumped Brighton 4-0 in midweek. Mengi comes into the defence and starts ahead of Burke. Former Newcastle winger Townsend, who scored the only goal in the reverse fixture, is on the bench.
This is the first time Newcastle are hosting Luton in a league match since September 1992, beating them 2-0 in the second tier under Kevin Keegan. Both teams are on the pitch and are ready to get started.
Luton get this Premier League clash under way. The Hatters will be hoping for another fast start, with Rob Edwards' men scoring twice in the first 137 seconds against Brighton in their last outing.
Luton start with an aggressive press and are looking to win possession in Newcastle's half. However, it opens the Hatters up for a counter, with Gordon racing down the right, cutting inside before having a pass across the box intercepted by Lokonga.
CHANCE! Luton are causing some early danger. Ogbene uses his speed to get on the end of a direct pass down the right. He gets beyond Burn and attempts to roll a pass across the box, but Schar slides across to make the interception.
Newcastle are passing the ball around their defensive third and are allowing Luton to come onto them. Schar takes too long in possession and Clark tackles him, but it rolls harmlessly back to Dubravka.
GOALLLL! LONGSTAFF SCORES! 1-0 NEWCASTLE! The hosts take an early lead. Miley collects possession just inside Luton's half and chips a superb pass down the right to Trippier. The right-back gets to the byline and cuts it back to Longstaff, who arrives in the box and drives his low effort into the bottom-left corner.
Miley's lofted pass down the right is excellent and it is matched by the pace of Trippier, who surges into the open space. The full-back then delivers an excellent cross into a dangerous area, with Longstaff burying his first-time strike.
Newcastle have lost just one of their last 17 Premier League games against promoted sides (winning nine and drawing seven), though it was their most recent match in the reverse fixture against Luton. Indeed, Luton could be just the second promoted side to do the double over the Magpies in the last seven seasons, after Leeds in 2020-21.
Ogbene is showing some real intent down the right. He bursts into the box and gets beyond Burn before cutting the ball back into the middle, but Schar clears it away for a throw-in.
Guimaraes is down just inside Luton's half and needs a few moments before returning to his feet. He looks to be struggling slightly. Howe will be hoping that it is nothing serious.
The battle between Ogbene and Burn on the right will be one to keep an eye on. The Luton winger is much quicker than the Magpies defender and is looking to go past him at every opportunity.
Adebayo runs down the left and wins Luton's first corner. Newcastle bring everyone back and load the box. Doughty finds Morris with an outswinging cross, but his tame header is caught with ease by Dubravka.
Burn makes a mess of a heavy touch on the right and is put under pressure by Ogbene, who wins possession well in an advanced position. However, he cannot get away from Burn, with the defender quickly winning it back.
Luton are sloppy in possession in their own half, with Newcastle winning it back on the left. Almiron collects it and attempts to curl an inviting cross into the box, but Kaminski rushes off his line to claim it.
GOALLL! LUTON ARE LEVEL! 1-1! Barkley is over a deep free-kick inside Newcastle's half on the right and he whips a cross onto the head of Morris. The striker knocks it across the box to Osho, who gets away from his maker and powers his header into the net.
Luton are always threatening from set-pieces and show their qualities again. Morris gets above his maker and finds Osho, who makes no mistake with an emphatic header from close range.
GOALLLL! LONGSTAFF SCORES AGAIN! 2-1 NEWCASTLE! The Magpies are ahead again. Gordon races away on the counter down the left and uses his pace to get beyond Osho. The winger then drives into the box and cuts onto his right foot before having a shot saved by Kaminski. However, Longstaff is quickest to the rebound to score.
Luton are winless in their last 21 league visits to the Magpies (drawing five and losing 16).
Trippier has a corner on the right and he curls an inswinging cross into the box. However, it goes over the head of everyone and out for a goal-kick. Osho was grabbing Botman and was fortunate not to be punished.
Kaminski is looking unconvincing in possession, with the Luton goalkeeper passing the ball straight out for a corner under pressure. Trippier tries a clever pass towards the outside of the box, but Clark reads it and makes the interception.
Doughty loses possession in Luton's half to Murphy, who attempts to whip a right-footed cross into the box from the right. However, Kaminski is quick off his line to catch it. The Hatters will be punished if they continue to lose the ball in their defensive third.
Adebayo looks to dribble past Botman to get into the box on the right but is stopped by the centre-back. He thinks he should have a free-kick, but the referee ignores his claims. The striker then shows his frustrations and fouls Schar.
Gordon arrives on the edge of the box on the right and offloads a pass to Murphy. He sets it across to Guimaraes, who makes a deep run from midfield to create an option, but he takes a heavy touch and the chance is gone.
Newcastle are having all the chances at the moment. Trippier strolls down the right and looks for options, finding Murphy on the overlap. He then cuts a pass across to Gordon, who makes a mess of the shot, sending his effort wide.
Ogbene trips an onrushing Miley next to the touchline on the left and gifts Newcastle a free-kick in a crossing position. Trippier switches sides to take it, but his ball into the box is cleared away with ease.
Luton's second corner is taken on the right by Doughty. However, his outswinging cross is headed away. The Hatters retain possession but are forced back to the halfway line by Newcastle's press.
GOALLL! BARKLEY SCORES! 2-2! Luton equalises for the second time. Barkley wins possession off Longstaff and drives towards the edge of the box before sliding a pass down the left to Doughty. His low strike is saved by Dubravka, but Barkley is there to thump in the rebound.
Barkley has now scored six goals in 16 appearances in the Premier League against Newcastle. He loves scoring against the Magpies and comes up with a valuable equaliser.
Adebayo has the ball on the right and directs a low cross towards Morris. However, the striker is put under pressure by Botman and cannot get it under control. Dubravka then claims it with ease.
There will be four minutes of additional time.
Morris gives away a needless foul just inside Newcastle's half with a push, giving the Magpies a chance to throw men forward towards the end of the first half. However, Mengi heads it clear just inside Luton's box.
Newcastle pass their way out of pressure and build an attack down the right after a clever pass from Gordon. Trippier and Murphy combine, with the latter sending a searching cross into the box that is put behind by Mengi.
HALF-TIME: NEWCASTLE UNITED 2-2 LUTON TOWN
Luton twice came from behind against Newcastle to send the teams into the break level at St. James' Park with the score 2-2. Longstaff netted the opener for the hosts inside seven minutes, getting onto the end of Trippier's low cross to power his low, first-time strike into the bottom-left corner. Osho then replied with a header from close range before the Magpies regained the lead moments later. Gordon made a surging run down the left before cutting into the box and unleashing a curling effort. Kaminski pushed it away, but Longstaff was there to score the rebound for his second goal of the contest. However, Barkley ensured that an entertaining first 45 minutes ended level. He dispossessed Longstaff and rolled a pass down the left side of the box to Doughty, who had his low strike saved. The ball dropped straight to the feet of Barkley, with the midfielder taking a touch to compose himself before thumping in the equaliser.
Luton created better opportunities before the break and created an xG (expected goals) of 1.27 compared to Newcastle's 0.99. Barkley had their most touches (47) and completed 88.2 per cent of his passes in an impressive midfield display. However, the Hatters must be more careful in the defensive third, as they have often gifted the ball to the Magpies, who haven't been able to capitalise. As for the hosts, they will be disappointed with their lack of control at home. Howe's men have had just 48.7 per cent of the possession, with most of their best opportunities coming from counters.
Howe makes a change before the restart to try and make Newcastle's attack more threatening. He brings on Wilson to add a recognised striker, with the England international making his first appearance since December 26. Gordon is off.
Newcastle get the ball rolling again.
Almiron twists in possession on the right and slides a fantastic throughball to Trippier, who races forward before going down under pressure from Doughty. He wants a free-kick on the edge of the box, but nothing is given.
SAVE! Huge opportunity for Newcastle. Wilson does brilliantly to collect the ball with his back to goal before flicking it around to Miley. He then finds Murphy, who gets into the box and dribbles past a defender before having a low drive saved by the foot of Kaminski.
Ogbene brings the ball forward down the right, waiting for support before sliding a pass down the wing to Clark. He attempts to loft a cross into the middle towards Adebayo, but it goes over his head and away from danger.
Murphy has a shot blocked just inside the box, but Newcastle retain possession through Miley, who gives it back to him. The winger then gets beyond a defender before lashing a shot wide of the near post on the left.
PENALTY SHOUT! Luton have a free-kick on the edge of the box, but the Hatters want a penalty. Ogbene drives beyond Burn on the right and gets past him before getting dragged back right on the edge.
Burn is shown a yellow card for dragging back Ogbene on the edge of the box. The VAR check is ongoing for a possible penalty.
PENALTY TO LUTON! The Hatters have the chance to get themselves ahead. Burn was dragging back Ogbene on the edge of the box, but the foul continued inside and a penalty is given. Morris has the ball in his hand.
WHAT! Morris strikes the penalty to the right of the goal and into the net, but the referee isn't ready and Morris is forced to take it again.
GOALLL! MORRIS SCORES! 3-2 LUTON! The Hatters are ahead for the first time. Morris takes a slow run before slotting his effort down the right side of the goal. Dubravka dives the other way.
Lokonga is shown a yellow card after dragging back Guimaraes around the halfway mark.
GOALLL! ADEBAYO SCORES! 4-2 LUTON! The Hatters score again! Trippier advances forward and leaves Doughty plenty of space to run into. He slides a pass across to Barkley, who is on the edge of the box. The midfielder then rolls a pass down the right to Adebayo, who drives his low strike across the goal and into the bottom-left corner.
Barkley has been excellent for Luton and adds an assist to his goal. He could shoot on the edge of the box but waits for the run of  Adebayo, who is completely free and finishes clinically.
Barnes makes his first appearance since September after a serious injury. He is on for Almiron in the attack.
Burn has had a torrid time at left-back and gave away a penalty for Luton's third goal. The electric Livramento replaces him in the defence to try and add some attacking qualities.
Adebayo has scored seven goals in his last eight Premier League appearances and netted the Hatters’ first top-flight hat-trick since September 1990 (Lars Elstrup vs Norwich) in their 4-0 win over Brighton.
GOALLLLL! TRIPPIER GETS ONE BACK FOR NEWCASTLE! The hosts needed that! Miley finds Guimaraes on the left, with the midfielder curling a cross with the outside of his boot towards Trippier. The right-back gets ahead of his marker and sends a first-time effort into the bottom-left corner. Luton lead 4-3.
A moment of brilliance from Guimaraes. He is on the corner of the box on the left and finds Trippier with an inventive cross with the outside of his boot. Trippier makes a bursting run and scores to get Newcastle's third goal.
Luton make a change immediately after Newcastle's goal. Mpanzu is on to replace Clark in this frantic contest.
Newcastle have lost their last two Premier League home games, as many as in their previous 16 at St James’ Park (winning 13 and drawing one). They last lost three in a row between January and February 2021 under Steve Bruce. They have the momentum and the home fans on their side, but Luton are still ahead.
Trippier is over a free-kick on the right in a crossing position. Wilson attacks it and Barkley heads it into the air. Kaminski pushes it away but not convincingly, with Schar's effort deflecting wide.
GOALLL! BARNES SCORES! 4-4! Newcastle come from two goals behind to level the score! Barnes receives possession from Miley on the edge of the box and shifts the ball onto his left foot before curling a low effort into the bottom-left corner. He went for accuracy rather than power to find the equaliser.
Miley is involved again, this time with a short pass on the edge of the box. However, the goal is all about Barnes, who curls his strike from range into the bottom-left corner.
Murphy makes a late slide tackle on Ogbene and is shown a yellow card.
WIDE! Newcastle are pushing for their fifth goal. Murphy gets down the right and flashes an inviting cross into the box. It is headed away from Wilson by Osho but straight to Barnes. He looks to score his second off the bench, with his right-footed effort defecting off of Mengi and behind.
Morris scored Luton's third and is now coming off. He hands the captain's armband to Mpanzu before coming off for Brown.
Doughty is also on his way off after an energetic performance on the left. He is replaced by Burke, who started the last match.
Brown gets straight into the action, getting down the left of the box and towards the byline. However, his cutback goes straight into the gloves of Dubravka.
WIDE! Schar drives through the middle of the pitch before rolling a pass down the left to Barnes. He curls a low shot across the goal, with the ball taking a slight deflection. Kaminski reacts quickly and pushes it behind.
Wilson protects the ball well from Osho and loops a pass over the top of Luton's defence, but Kaminski runs off his line to catch it.
OVER! What an opportunity for Murphy. Guimaraes speeds down the left and looks to get his second assist with the outside of his right foot. The ball flashes across the face of the goal and towards Murphy, but he shoots over from a tight angle.
Adebayo went down a few moments ago but is now back on his feet to come off. Woodrow is on for the final few minutes to try and make an impression. What an opportunity for the striker to score the winner.
Schar takes a quick free-kick in Newcastle's half and drives a pass forward to Wilson. He accidentally trips Osho and gives away a free-kick after a tangle of legs.
Osho goes into the book after dragging back Wilson.
There will be 10 minutes of additional time. There should be no surprise after four goals and VAR drama!
Newcastle have all the momentum and are pushing for the winner. They still have seven minutes to score their fifth goal but are looking to put crosses into the box at every opportunity. Luton have a height advantage and have dealt with the pressure well.
Ogbene and Woodrow play a clever one-two on the right, giving the former of the pair space to run into. He gets to the byline and cuts a pass back towards Mpanzu, but Livramento makes an important covering run to make the interception.
Brown is down and receiving treatment after a collision. However, he will be able to continue. This will only further extend the added time and the drama.
Trippier trips Mpanzu and wins a free-kick in a crossing position for Luton. Barkley's cross drops in the middle of the box before getting hacked away by the Newcastle defence.
CHANCE! What an opportunity for Luton to score the winner. Barkley makes the most of a loose pass from Schar. He has possession on the left and curls a right-footed cross over to Ogbene on the right side of the box. He attempts a first-time volley, but Dubravka makes a simple save under pressure.
The allocated additional time has now ended, but the match continues. Newcastle surge forward on the counter. However, Luton get men back before Trippier's cross from the right is blocked.
FULL-TIME: NEWCASTLE UNITED 4-4 LUTON TWON
Newcastle came from two goals down in the second half to draw 4-4 with Luton in a Premier League classic at St. James' Park. The Hatters twice came from behind before the break to level the score. Longstaff netted a brace, getting onto the end of Trippier's cutback to break the deadlock before reacting the quickest to a rebounded strike from Gordon to add his second. However, the Hatters were resilient. Osho headed in their first, with Barkley crashing in his strike from close range after Doughty's shot was pushed into his path. Luton then gained control after scoring twice to go 4-2 ahead. The referee pointed to the spot after a VAR check, with Burn pulling back Ogbene just inside the box. Morris rolled in the spot-kick to put the visitors ahead before Adebayo added their fourth with a low strike into the bottom-left corner. However, they couldn't hold onto their lead. Trippier started the comeback with a goal before Barnes netted their leveller with an accurate strike from the edge into the bottom-left corner. Next up, Newcastle travel to Nottingham Forest in the Premier League, with Luton hosting Sheffield United. That's all, goodbye.
summary:
Ollie Watkins’ return to form continued with a double that lifted Aston Villa into the top four with a 2-1 win at Fulham. 
Villa took advantage of Tottenham Hotspur's 2-1 defeat at home to Wolverhampton Wanderers to go into the top four with 49 points. 
How the match unfolded
Fulham were unchanged while Unai Emery made two enforced changes – the injured duo of Diego Carlos and Boubacar Kamara were replaced by Pau Torres and Youri Tielemans.
After a stop-start opening, Watkins claimed his 12th Premier League goal of the season, capitalising on a poor Fulham throw to pick up the ball from Jacob Ramsey before swivelling and drilling the ball past Bernd Leno in the 23rd minute. 
Leon Bailey almost doubled the lead five minutes later with a brilliant bit of skill and then shot, but his dipping effort struck the bar. 
Alex Moreno also came close to scoring Villa’s second but he was adjudged to be offside before heading in from Watkins’ flick-on. Just before half-time Watkins broke clear and set up Tielemans but Leno came out well to smother his shot and keep the visitors’ lead at one goal at the break. 
Fulham started the second half well after Willian was replaced by Alex Iwobi on the Nigerian's return from the Africa Cup of Nations. But Villa grabbed their second goal on 56 minutes, again through Watkins. The striker was found by Tielemans’ through-ball and finished with aplomb. 
Out of nowhere Fulham got a goal back. Antonee Robinson outpaced Matty Cash down the left and crossed, and Rodrigo Muniz got to the ball ahead of both Emiliano Martinez and Clement Lenglet at the near post to score his fourth goal in three matches. 
Fulham came close to an equaliser from a sweeping move that ended with Iwobi shooting from close range, but Martinez, having dived the wrong way, stopped the shot with his legs before Harry Wilson shot wide. 
Fulham continued to threaten but substitute Adama Traore was also unable to beat Martinez in stoppage time. The Cottagers remain 12th with 29 points. 
Club reports
Fulham report | Aston Villa report
Match officials
Referee: Lewis Smith. Assistants: Eddie Smart, Nick Greenhalgh. Fourth official: Darren England. VAR: John Brooks. Assistant VAR: Natalie Aspinall.
text:
["Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League clash between Team_15 and Team_12 at St. James' Park.
Team_15 ended a four-match losing run in the Premier League with a 3-1 win over Team_2 in their last outing. The Villans had won 16 of their previous 17 games at home in the top flight, but a brace from Fabian Schar and an own goal from Alex Moreno helped the Magpies to a comfortable three-goal lead before Ollie Watkins netted a consolation. A third straight-away victory in all competitions lifted Eddie Howe's men into eighth position. Team_15 are 14 points behind fourth-placed Team_18, meaning their chances of qualifying for the Champions League for the second successive season is very unlikely. However, they will still be hoping that a place in the Europa League or Europa Conference League is in their grasp. Despite this, the Magpies must improve their form at St. James' Park, with the hosts losing back-to-back fixtures against Team_16 and Team_13.
Luton are in good form in the Premier League and have won three of their last five matches to take themselves out of the relegation zone and into 17th position. Securing two consecutive triumphs over Team_15 and Team_17 at the start of the run, the Hatters lost 3-2 to Team_7 before collecting a point against Team_6. However, Rob Edwards' men returned to winning ways with their most emphatic win of the season in their previous match, with a hat-trick from Elijah Adebayo and a goal from Chiedozie Ogbene helping them secure a 4-0 win over European hopefuls Team_5. It was a special victory for Luton, with captain Tom Lockyer making his first appearance at Kenilworth Road since suffering a cardiac arrest in December's game at Team_3. The visitors will now be looking to complete a famous double over Team_15 for the first time since the 1937-38 campaign.
Team_15 (4-3-3): Martin Dubravka; Kieran Trippier, Fabian Schar, Sven Botman, Dan Burn; Sean Longstaff, Bruno Guimaraes, Lewis Miley; Miguel Almiron, Jacob Murphy, Anthony Gordon.
Team_15 SUBS: Paul Dummett, Callum Wilson, Matt Ritchie, Harvey Barnes, Emil Krafth, Loris Karius, Lewis Hall, Tino Livramento, Joe White.
Team_12 (3-4-2-1): Thomas Kaminski; Teden Mengi, Gabriel Osho, Amari'i Bell; Chiedozie Ogbene, Albert Sambi Lokonga, Ross Barkley, Alfie Doughty; Jordan Clark, Elijah Adebayo; Carlton Morris.
Team_12 SUBS: Luke Berry, Cauley Woodrow, Issa Kabore, Tahith Chong, Reece Burke, Pelly Ruddock Mpanzu, Jacob Brown, Tim Krul, Andros Townsend.
Team_15 make one enforced change to the side that beat Villa 3-1 in their last Premier League outing. Alexander Isak went off with a groin injury and is replaced in the attack by Almiron. However, there is a double boost for the injury-hit Magpies, with Barnes and Wilson back on the bench after a spell on the sidelines.
Luton make one alteration to the team that thumped Team_5 4-0 in midweek. Mengi comes into the defence and starts ahead of Burke. Former Team_15 winger Townsend, who scored the only goal in the reverse fixture, is on the bench.
This is the first time Team_15 are hosting Luton in a league match since September 1992, beating them 2-0 in the second tier under Kevin Keegan. Both teams are on the pitch and are ready to get started.
Luton get this Premier League clash under way. The Hatters will be hoping for another fast start, with Rob Edwards' men scoring twice in the first 137 seconds against Team_5 in their last outing.
Luton start with an aggressive press and are looking to win possession in Team_15 half. However, it opens the Hatters up for a counter, with Gordon racing down the right, cutting inside before having a pass across the box intercepted by Lokonga.
CHANCE! Luton are causing some early danger. Ogbene uses his speed to get on the end of a direct pass down the right. He gets beyond Burn and attempts to roll a pass across the box, but Schar slides across to make the interception.
Team_15 are passing the ball around their defensive third and are allowing Luton to come onto them. Schar takes too long in possession and Clark tackles him, but it rolls harmlessly back to Dubravka.
GOALLLL!\xa0LONGSTAFF SCORES! 1-0 Team_15! The hosts take an early lead. Miley collects possession just inside Luton's half and chips a superb pass down the right to\xa0Trippier. The right-back gets to the byline and cuts it back to Longstaff, who arrives in the box and drives his low effort into the bottom-left corner.
Miley's lofted pass down the right is excellent and it is matched by the pace of Trippier, who surges into the open space. The full-back then delivers an excellent cross into a dangerous area, with Longstaff burying his first-time strike.
Team_15 have lost just one of their last 17 Premier League games against promoted sides (winning nine and drawing seven), though it was their most recent match in the reverse fixture against Luton. Indeed, Luton could be just the second promoted side to do the double over the Magpies in the last seven seasons, after Leeds in 2020-21.
Ogbene is showing some real intent down the right. He bursts into the box and gets beyond Burn before cutting the ball back into the middle, but Schar clears it away for a throw-in.
Guimaraes is down just inside Luton's half and needs a few moments before returning to his feet. He looks to be struggling slightly. Howe will be hoping that it is nothing serious.
The battle between Ogbene and Burn on the right will be one to keep an eye on. The Luton winger is much quicker than the Magpies defender and is looking to go past him at every opportunity.
Adebayo runs down the left and wins Luton's first corner. Team_15 bring everyone back and load the box. Doughty finds Morris with an outswinging cross, but his tame header is caught with ease by Dubravka.
Burn makes a mess of a heavy touch on the right and is put under pressure by Ogbene, who wins possession well in an advanced position. However, he cannot get away from Burn, with the defender quickly winning it back.
Luton are sloppy in possession in their own half, with Team_15 winning it back on the left. Almiron collects it and attempts to curl an inviting cross into the box, but Kaminski rushes off his line to claim it.
GOALLL! LUTON ARE LEVEL! 1-1! Barkley is over a deep free-kick inside Team_15 half on the right and he whips a cross onto the head of Morris. The striker knocks it across the box to Osho, who gets away from his maker and powers his header into the net.
Luton are always threatening from set-pieces and show their qualities again. Morris gets above his maker and finds Osho, who makes no mistake with an emphatic header from close range.
GOALLLL! LONGSTAFF SCORES AGAIN! 2-1 Team_15! The Magpies are ahead again. Gordon races away on the counter down the left and uses his pace to get beyond Osho. The winger then drives into the box and cuts onto his right foot before having a shot saved by Kaminski. However, Longstaff is quickest to the rebound to score.
Luton are winless in their last 21 league visits to the Magpies (drawing five and losing 16).
Trippier has a corner on the right and he curls an inswinging cross into the box. However, it goes over the head of everyone and out for a goal-kick. Osho was grabbing Botman and was fortunate not to be punished.
Kaminski is looking unconvincing in possession, with the Luton goalkeeper passing the ball straight out for a corner under pressure. Trippier tries a clever pass towards the outside of the box, but Clark reads it and makes the interception.
Doughty loses possession in Luton's half to Murphy, who attempts to whip a right-footed cross into the box from the right. However, Kaminski is quick off his line to catch it. The Hatters will be punished if they continue to lose the ball in their defensive third.
Adebayo looks to dribble past Botman to get into the box on the right but is stopped by the centre-back. He thinks he should have a free-kick, but the referee ignores his claims. The striker then shows his frustrations and fouls Schar.
Gordon arrives on the edge of the box on the right and offloads a pass to Murphy. He sets it across to Guimaraes, who makes a deep run from midfield to create an option, but he takes a heavy touch and the chance is gone.
Team_15 are having all the chances at the moment. Trippier strolls down the right and looks for options, finding Murphy on the overlap. He then cuts a pass across to Gordon, who makes a mess of the shot, sending his effort wide.
Ogbene trips an onrushing Miley next to the touchline on the left and gifts Team_15 a free-kick in a crossing position. Trippier switches sides to take it, but his ball into the box is cleared away with ease.
Luton's second corner is taken on the right by Doughty. However, his outswinging cross is headed away. The Hatters retain possession but are forced back to the halfway line by Team_15 press.
GOALLL! BARKLEY SCORES! 2-2! Luton equalises for the second time. Barkley wins possession off Longstaff and drives towards the edge of the box before sliding a pass down the left to Doughty. His low strike is saved by Dubravka, but Barkley is there to thump in the rebound.
Barkley has now scored six goals in 16 appearances in the Premier League against Team_15. He loves scoring against the Magpies and comes up with a valuable equaliser.
Adebayo has the ball on the right and directs a low cross towards Morris. However, the striker is put under pressure by Botman and cannot get it under control. Dubravka then claims it with ease.
There will be four minutes of additional time.
Morris gives away a needless foul just inside Team_15 half with a push, giving the Magpies a chance to throw men forward towards the end of the first half. However, Mengi heads it clear just inside Luton's box.
Team_15 pass their way out of pressure and build an attack down the right after a clever pass from Gordon. Trippier and Murphy combine, with the latter sending a searching cross into the box that is put behind by Mengi.
HALF-TIME: Team_15 2-2 Team_12
Luton twice came from behind against Team_15 to send the teams into the break level at St. James' Park with the score 2-2. Longstaff netted the opener for the hosts inside seven minutes, getting onto the end of Trippier's low cross to power his low, first-time strike into the bottom-left corner. Osho then replied with a header from close range before the Magpies regained the lead moments later. Gordon made a surging run down the left before cutting into the box and unleashing a curling effort. Kaminski pushed it away, but Longstaff was there to score the rebound for his second goal of the contest. However, Barkley ensured that an entertaining first 45 minutes ended level. He dispossessed Longstaff and rolled a pass down the left side of the box to Doughty, who had his low strike saved. The ball dropped straight to the feet of Barkley, with the midfielder taking a touch to compose himself before thumping in the equaliser.
Luton created better opportunities before the break and created an xG (expected goals) of 1.27 compared to Team_15 0.99. Barkley had their most touches (47) and completed 88.2 per cent of his passes in an impressive midfield display. However, the Hatters must be more careful in the defensive third, as they have often gifted the ball to the Magpies, who haven't been able to capitalise. As for the hosts, they will be disappointed with their lack of control at home. Howe's men have had just 48.7 per cent of the possession, with most of their best opportunities coming from counters.
Howe makes a change before the restart to try and make Team_15 attack more threatening. He brings on Wilson to add a recognised striker, with the England international making his first appearance since December 26. Gordon is off.
Team_15 get the ball rolling again.
Almiron twists in possession on the right and slides a fantastic throughball to Trippier, who races forward before going down under pressure from Doughty. He wants a free-kick on the edge of the box, but nothing is given.
SAVE! Huge opportunity for Team_15. Wilson does brilliantly to collect the ball with his back to goal before flicking it around to Miley. He then finds Murphy, who gets into the box and dribbles past a defender before having a low drive saved by the foot of Kaminski.
Ogbene brings the ball forward down the right, waiting for support before sliding a pass down the wing to Clark. He attempts to loft a cross into the middle towards Adebayo, but it goes over his head and away from danger.
Murphy has a shot blocked just inside the box, but Team_15 retain possession through Miley, who gives it back to him. The winger then gets beyond a defender before lashing a shot wide of the near post on the left.
PENALTY SHOUT! Luton have a free-kick on the edge of the box, but the Hatters want a penalty. Ogbene drives beyond Burn on the right and gets past him before getting dragged back right on the edge.
Burn is shown a yellow card for dragging back\xa0Ogbene on the edge of the box. The VAR check is ongoing for a possible penalty.
PENALTY TO LUTON! The Hatters have the chance to get themselves ahead. Burn was dragging back Ogbene on the edge of the box, but the foul continued inside and a penalty is given. Morris has the ball in his hand.
WHAT! Morris strikes the penalty to the right of the goal and into the net, but the referee isn't ready and Morris is forced to take it again.
GOALLL! MORRIS SCORES! 3-2 LUTON! The Hatters are ahead for the first time. Morris takes a slow run before slotting his effort down the right side of the goal. Dubravka dives the other way.
Lokonga is shown a yellow card after dragging back Guimaraes around the halfway mark.
GOALLL!\xa0ADEBAYO SCORES! 4-2 LUTON! The Hatters score again! Trippier advances forward and leaves\xa0Doughty plenty of space to run into. He slides a pass across to Barkley, who is on the edge of the box. The midfielder then rolls a pass down the right to Adebayo, who drives his low strike across the goal and into the bottom-left corner.
Barkley has been excellent for Luton and adds an assist to his goal. He could shoot on the edge of the box but waits for the run of \xa0Adebayo, who is completely free and finishes clinically.
Barnes makes his first appearance since September after a serious injury. He is on for\xa0Almiron in the attack.

Adebayo has scored seven goals in his last eight Premier League appearances and netted the Hatters’ first top-flight hat-trick since September 1990 (Lars Elstrup vs Norwich) in their 4-0 win over Team_5.
GOALLLLL! TRIPPIER GETS ONE BACK FOR Team_15! The hosts needed that! Miley finds Guimaraes on the left, with the midfielder curling a cross with the outside of his boot towards Trippier. The right-back gets ahead of his marker and sends a first-time effort into the bottom-left corner. Luton lead 4-3.
A moment of brilliance from Guimaraes. He is on the corner of the box on the left and finds Trippier with an inventive cross with the outside of his boot. Trippier makes a bursting run and scores to get Team_15 third goal.
Luton make a change immediately after Team_15 goal.\xa0Mpanzu is on to replace\xa0Clark in this frantic contest.
Team_15 have lost their last two Premier League home games, as many as in their previous 16 at St James’ Park (winning 13 and drawing one). They last lost three in a row between January and February 2021 under Steve Bruce. They have the momentum and the home fans on their side, but Luton are still ahead.
Trippier is over a free-kick on the right in a crossing position. Wilson attacks it and Barkley heads it into the air. Kaminski pushes it away but not convincingly, with Schar's effort deflecting wide.

Barnes receives possession from Miley on the edge of the box and shifts the ball onto his left foot before curling a low effort into the bottom-left corner. He went for accuracy rather than power to find the equaliser.
Miley is involved again, this time with a short pass on the edge of the box. However, the goal is all about Barnes, who curls his strike from range into the bottom-left corner.
Murphy\xa0makes a late slide tackle on\xa0Ogbene\xa0and is shown a yellow card.
WIDE! Team_15 are pushing for their fifth goal. Murphy gets down the right and flashes an inviting cross into the box. It is headed away from Wilson by Osho but straight to Barnes. He looks to score his second off the bench, with his right-footed effort defecting off of Mengi and behind.
Morris scored Luton's third and is now coming off. He hands the captain's armband to Mpanzu before coming off for Brown.
Doughty is also on his way off after an energetic performance on the left. He is replaced by Burke, who started the last match.
Brown gets straight into the action, getting down the left of the box and towards the byline. However, his cutback goes straight into the gloves of Dubravka.

Luton then gained control after scoring twice to go 4-2 ahead. The referee pointed to the spot after a VAR check, with Burn pulling back Ogbene just inside the box. Morris rolled in the spot-kick to put the visitors ahead before Adebayo added their fourth with a low strike into the bottom-left corner. However, they couldn't hold onto their lead.
