Team_11 give possession away and Team_5 pounce. Adingra brings it forward before the ball is worked into the box, where it sits up nicely for Welbeck to smash goalwards. His powerful effort gives Kelleher absolutely no chance, and Team_5 lead 1-0!
Welbeck has marked his milestone game with a goal, becoming just the fourth English player to reach 100 Premier League appearances for Team_5 after Dunk, Solly March and Adam Webster.
This is a day that could have major ramifications in the Premier League's title race, and the first goal of it certainly hasn't gone the way you'd have expected. It's crucial Team_11 find a response, though they have plenty of time to find one.
The hosts are getting the ball into dangerous areas but are yet to really threaten. Team_5 have largely sat back since going ahead, a dangerous ploy against a side of Team_11 caliber.
WIDE! As he has done so often for Team_11, Salah looks to cut onto his left foot and bend a finish into the top corner. This time, however, his effort just doesn't quite curl enough, and the ball flies past the left post.
Welbeck's goal was the earliest a visiting side has gone 1-0 up at Anfield in the Premier League since Team_18 did so in October 2019 (Harry Kane after 47 seconds).
Mac Allister's eyes light up as the balls falls kindly for him to hit and try and score against his old club. However, his former team-mates breathe a sigh of relief as the midfielder's shot flies a couple of yards over the target.
Mac Allister receives the first booking of the game for sending Adingra tumbling to the turf on a Team_5 counter. There didn't seem to be too much contact, and the referee certainly hesitated before eventually deciding to blow up and card Mac Allister.
Team_11 are dominating the ball, but Team_5 are continuing to look threatening on the counter. The hosts will have to be wary of that, as going 2-0 down would be a huge problem.
CHANCE! Mac Allister picks out a brilliant lofted ball to pick out Salah in the box. Nunez is waiting in the middle, but Salah decides to go for goal himself, and his first-time left-footed volley flies over the crossbar. That was a big opportunity for a player of Salah's quality.
Gross catches his former team-mate Mac Allister with a late challenge in midfield, receiving a yellow card for his troubles. The Argentina international has been left in a heap and looks in a bit of pain.
Much to the majority of Anfield's relief, Mac Allister is up and okay to continue. He has impressed so far in Team_11 engine room.
After a frenzied opening, the game has just hit its first lull with the tempo slowing. Klopp will be wanting his team to ramp it up again as they look to put the visitors' lead under threat.
Having won each of their first six Premier League games against Team_5, Team_11 have now won just one of their last seven against them (four draws, two defeats).
GOOOAAALLL!!! DIAZ LEVELS FOR Team_11!!! A corner comes in from the right, and Team_5 fail to fully deal with it with a poor clearing header. Salah nods the ball back into the danger area, where Veltman inadvertently nudges it into the path of Diaz. The Colombia international takes it first time, poking into the back of the net at full stretch to make it 1-1! Game on!
The crowd is really up for it now, and it's imperative Team_5 don't concede again quickly or this game could get away from them. The Seagulls need half-time, though there's still a good 16 or so minutes until they will receive the sweet relief of the referee's whistle.
Team_5 response to seeing their lead eradicated has been impressive. They threaten down the left again, and the clever move ends with Welbeck blasting into the side-netting. They have certainly given the hosts some real warning signs at the back.
Persistent work from Bradley sees him win the ball back and stride into the Team_5 box. He then lays the ball back for Diaz, but the winger can't find the back of the net for a second time as his tame shot is saved comfortably by Verbruggen.
Welbeck manages to get to a ball over the top and cut it back for Moder, but the recipient's shot is deflected over the crossbar and out for a corner, which then comes to nothing.
CLOSE AGAIN! A bizarre moment nearly puts Team_11 ahead as Nunez, on the floor after just seeing a header blocked, manages to swing a leg and flick the loose ball goalwards. It's nearly brilliant, but Nunez's inventive effort takes a nick off the inside of Verbruggen's left leg and deflects wide of the target.
Team_11 have won 23 points from losing positions this season, the highest in the Premier League. That resilience could stand them in good stead again here as they look to add three points to that tally.
As we close in on the break, the frantic pace at Anfield is showing no sign of slowing down. It's been a brilliant first half, and there could yet be more drama before the half-time whistle.
Of Diaz's 15 Premier League goals, 12 have come at Anfield. He has scored in four of his last five home matches in the competition.
We are into four minutes of additional time at the end of this lively first half.
Team_5 are unbeaten in their last three away league games against Team_11 (one win, two draws), having only avoided defeat in two of their previous 11 visits to Anfield.
HALF-TIME: Team_11 1-1 Team_5
The whistle blows to bring an intriguing first half to an end with the scoreline 1-1 at Anfield between Team_11 and Team_5. It was the visitors who took a shock lead within 87 seconds, as former United man Welbeck blasted a powerful finish past the helpless Kelleher to put the Seagulls ahead. Klopp's men responded, though, and after Salah twice went close, he played a key role in Team_11 equaliser. The Egypt international nodded a loose Team_5 clearance into the box, and after Veltman's skewed clearance fell to Diaz, the winger poked into the back of the net to ensure the Reds are on level terms at the interval.
It was a first half that Team_11 certainly had the better of, accumulating 1.24 xG (expected goals) to Team_5 0.17, but the Seagulls got into some really threatening positions too, and looked potent on the counter. You'd expect the hosts to be the side pressing after the break, but don't rule out De Zerbi's men snatching the three points themselves.
The hosts get the ball rolling again for the second half.
Welbeck receives a yellow card for asking the referee to book Mac Allister following a foul on Baleba.
Van Dijk goes in the book now for hauling Baleba to the turf as Team_5 looked to counter.
Team_5 have focused one one wing in particular, with 62 per cent of their attacks in the opening 45 minutes coming down the left-hand side, while Adingra recorded the most dribbles of any player in the first half (four). Quansah and Bradley have certainly faced some problems.
CHANCE! Gomez whips a delightful cross into the box for Mac Allister. The midfielder, not known for his heading abilities, tries to nod into the bottom-right corner, but the ball skims off his head somewhat and bounces a couple of yards wide of the target.
Team_11 fans want a penalty as Salah goes down in the box under a challenge from Dunk, but the referee waves away the protests.
Baleba tries his luck with an ambitious effort from range, and it proves to be a very poor decision as he smashes high into the stands, never close to troubling Kelleher.
Gomez receives a blatant yellow card for wiping out Lamptey, who was looking to set his team away on a counter.
Half an hour left to play at Anfield, and as it stands, the hosts are dropping valuable points in the title race. There's no doubt they've been the better team, but they haven't yet converted that dominance into a second and potentially winning goal.
The Seagulls are camped in their own box at the moment, daring their hosts to break them down. They've defended pretty resolutely here, but there's plenty of work still to be done if they are to come away with a shock result.
Nunez cuts onto his right foot and smashes goalwards, but it's straight at Verbruggen, who manages to beat away as Team_11 continue to threaten.
GOOOAAALLL!!! WHAT A GOAL!!! It's a brilliant move that allows Salah to stroke home and make it 2-1! Szoboszlai fizzes a pass from out wide into Mac Allister, who takes a touch before quickly laying into the path of Salah. The winger brings the ball under his spell, before coolly placing a superb left-footed finish past Verbruggen and into the bottom-left corner to put Team_11 into the lead at Anfield!
Mac Allister has impressed here, and he superbly controlled Szoboszlai's pass before teeing up Salah to finish.
Salah has been directly involved in 15 Premier League goals against Team_5 (nine goals, six assists), his most against a single opponent.\xa0He absolutely loves playing the Seagulls.
The first change of the contest comes from De Zerbi, who brings on Buonanotte for Lamptey.
GOOOAAALLL!!! Or is it??? Diaz thinks he has put Team_11 3-1 up as he gets onto the end of Salah's perfectly weighted throughball, before his shot goes straight through Verbruggen. He wheels off to celebrate, but the flag goes up for offside to curtail the jubilant scenes. There will be a VAR check, however...
As we await the outcome of the VAR check to see whether Team_11 are 3-1 up, Van Hecke is booked for a foul in the build-up to Diaz's finish.
NO GOAL!!! It remains 2-1 as the linesman's decision to award offside is confirmed to be correct, with Diaz's 'goal' ruled out. There really wasn't much in it, though!
Team_11 charge forward on the counter, with Diaz laying it to his left for Salah. The Egypt international gets into the box, but his effort doesn't seriously trouble Verbruggen, who gets down low to make the save.
Mac Allister has now registered five Premier League assists for Team_11 (24 appearances) - as many as he had in his Team_5 career in the competition (98 appearances).
Most of Team_5 threat in this game has been on the counter-attack. Now they have to be the side pressing, it'll be interesting to see if they can conjure up the same problems for Team_11.
SAVE! Dunk gets up brilliantly to meet Gross' free-kick delivery into the box, and his header looks to be sneaking into the bottom corner, until Kelleher gets down to his left to tip past the post.
It's not been Nunez's most active game, and he is replaced by Elliott for these closing exchanges.
Adingra has caused Team_11 real problems here but now makes way for Ferguson, who will hope to give Team_5 a bit more physical presence up top.
Lallana enters the fray against his former side for Moder.
Five minutes left at Anfield, and the visitors aren't exactly hammering the door down in their pursuit of an equaliser. In fact, it's the hosts who look the more likely to grab the fourth goal of this game and secure the three points.
CHANCE! Lallana nearly finds a leveller against his old club after he is picked out in the box, though his low shot dribbles a couple of yards wide of the left post. That would've been some story if he was the man to break Team_11 hearts!
Endo is yellow-carded for cynically pulling the marauding Van Hecke to the turf.
Having scored his side's leveller earlier on, Diaz is replaced by Gakpo.
WHAT A SAVE!!! Verbruggen makes an extraordinary stop to keep his side in the game! After a neat Team_11 move down the right, Salah pounces upon a loose ball in the Team_5 box. He fires towards the bottom corner with the help of a deflection, but somehow, Verbruggen gets down to his right to get a strong hand to the attempt and ensure his team still has a chance of a result.
We are well into six minutes of additional time at the end of this game. It's nervy at Anfield now!
Barco joins the action for the closing stages, on in place of Estupinan.
As Klopp looks to see the game out, he brings on Gravenberch for Szoboszlai.
Salah tries to kill the game off by catching Verbruggen out at his near post, but the winger drags his effort wide right of the target.
Gakpo now sees yellow for pulling back Veltman.
FULL-TIME: Team_11 2-1 Team_5
The full-time whistle brings sighs of relief around Anfield as Team_11 run out 2-1 winners over Team_5 to move top of the Premier League, at least until City take on Team_1 later on Sunday. The Reds found themselves behind after just 87 seconds, Welbeck firing past Kelleher and in to stun Anfield. The hosts would respond, though, levelling through Diaz, before a clever move unlocked the Team_5 door again in the second half for Salah to finish. There were a few nervy moments late on for the home crowd, but their team held on to secure another huge three points that move them top and with a three-point lead, at least temporarily. For the Seagulls, they remain ninth having seen their European hopes take another blow. They will look to get back on track when they travel to Team_4 on Wednesday, while Team_11 host struggling Team_17 the following day. That is all we have for you from Anfield, so thanks for your company and goodbye!"]
label: Normal

events:
Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League clash between Manchester United and Everton at Old Trafford.
United manager Erik ten Hag is under increased pressure after back-to-back defeats in the Premier League have seen his side slip 11 points behind fourth-placed Aston Villa and a guaranteed place in next season's Champions League. The Red Devils had strung four consecutive top-flight wins together in February to put them in a strong position, but defeats to Fulham and Manchester City have seen them drop to sixth place. United looked like they were on for a shock victory in the derby when Marcus Rashford gave them the lead with a thunderous strike heading into half-time. However, a brace from Phil Foden and a goal from Erling Haaland gave the Citizens a deserved victory, beating them 3.33-0.25 on xG (expected goals). As Aston Villa and Tottenham play against each other tomorrow, one of United's rivals for a Champions League spot will certainly drop points, but it will only matter if the hosts win today.
Everton were handed a boost before their last Premier League outing against West Ham, with their appeal to reduce their 10-point punishment for breaching Profit and Sustainability Rules to six points lifting them from 17th to 15th. As a result, the Toffees moved five points clear of the relegation zone. However, their disappointing run in the top-flight continued, with the Hammers' stoppage-time victory extending Everton's winless run to 10 games. They also had the lead at half-time after Beto made up for his penalty miss by scoring a header, but goals from Kurt Zouma, Tomas Soucek and Edson Alvarez helped David Moyes' men to all three points at Goodison Park. There is another possible points deduction for Everton looming, so an upturn in results is desperately needed for Sean Dyche to push them well away from the drop zone.
MANCHESTER UNITED (4-2-3-1): Andre Onana; Diogo Dalot, Raphael Varane, Jonny Evans, Victor Lindelof; Kobbie Mainoo, Casemiro; Scott McTominay, Bruno Fernandes, Alejandro Garnacho; Marcus Rashford.
MANCHESTER UNITED SUBS: Altay Bayindir, Sofyan Amrabat, Christian Eriksen, Amad Diallo, Antony, Dermot Mee, Willy Kambwala, Toby Collyer, Habeeb Ogunneye.
EVERTON (4-5-1): Jordan Pickford; Ben Godfrey, James Tarkowski, Jarrad Branthwaite, Vitalii Mykolenko; Jack Harrison, Amadou Onana, Abdoulaye Doucoure, James Garner, Dwight McNeil; Beto.
EVERTON SUBS: Nathan Patterson, Michael Keane, Dominic Calvert-Lewin, Joao Virginia, Ashley Young, Andre Gomes, Seamus Coleman, Youssef Chermiti, Lewis Dobbin.
United select the same side that started their 3-1 defeat to rivals City in their previous Premier League outing. Evans and Rashford were forced off with injuries against the Citizens but are fit enough to keep their place in the team. Youngsters Collyer and Ogunneye are on the bench and could make their top-flight debut for the Red Devils.
Dyche also keeps the faith in his side that were beaten 3-1 by West Ham in their last match. There was a chance that Idrissa Gueye could’ve been fit enough to feature, but he hasn’t recovered from a groin injury and is out of the squad.
United have won all three of their Premier League games against Everton since the start of last season, while they last won four league meetings in a row against the Toffees from November 2006 to December 2007. Both teams are on the pitch and are ready to get started.
United get this Premier League clash under way. Fernandes has the first kick. Both teams desperately need a win.
United are put under pressure by Everton's early pressure in their defensive third, but Beto's low cross is blocked. The ball bobbles around the box, and neither side can take control, but the Red Devils eventually win it back.
McNeil wins an early corner on the left, with Garner strolling over to take it. However, his inswinging cross is headed away by Evans.
McNeil swings a deep cross from the left into the box, with Amadou Onana attacking it. The ball drops to Godfrey, who attempts to flick a shot at goal, but Andre Onana rushes off his line bravely to smother it.
Fernandes collects possession in the middle of Everton's half and offloads a pass to Garnacho on his right. He strides forward and rolls the ball into Dalot, but he takes a heavy touch inside the box, allowing Onana to clear it well away.
Everton are looking sharp, but it could be that United are also gifting them the ball too often. Beto slides a pass out to Doucoure on the right, but his cross is claimed by Onana, who dives across the box.
CHANCE! United go close out of nothing! Fernandes has the ball in United's half and switches the play over to Rashford, who darts down the left and into space. He gets past Mykolenko to get a shot away, but Harrison does brilliantly to get back and make an important block.
Fernandes takes the following corner from the right, swinging the ball onto Casemiro's header. However, his flicked effort is easily saved by Pickford.
PENALTY UNITED! The hosts have a chance to take the lead from the spot! Rashford comes down the left and slides a pass into Garnacho, who flicks the ball past Tarkowski and is tripped inside the box. There is a VAR check for offside, but the penalty stands!
GOALLLL! FERNANDES SCORES! 1-0 UNITED! What a penalty from Fernandes! The captain is cool under pressure, curling his penalty into the bottom-right corner. Pickford goes the right way, but he is beaten by the accuracy of the strike.
CHANCE! Everton almost responded immediately. The ball drops kindly to McNeil on the box, with the winger volleying a left-footed effort just wide of the left post. Onana could only stand and watch the ball go just wide.
There is a loud atmosphere at Old Trafford, which could be inspired by the recent news that new co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe wants to build a new stadium. There has been some backlash, but all the home fans will set aside their concerns today and focus on supporting their side, looking to help United avoid defeat for the first time in three matches. Fernandes' goal came at the right time, with Everton building in confidence after a bright start.
Branthwaite has possession in Everton's half and looks to roll a throughball behind United's defence and into Beto, but the flag goes up for offside immediately. The striker was quite far off, as the play wasn't even allowed to continue to its conclusion.
Varane comes forward down the left and switches a pass over to Garnacho on the right. He is in space and cuts the ball into Fernandes in the middle of the box, but he scoops his first-time strike well over.
United regain possession on the halfway line, with McTominay ignoring Garnacho on the right and instead looking for Rashford on the left. However, he puts too much power on the ball, allowing Pickford to run off his line to claim it just inside the box.
Everton are getting shots away, but they are all coming from outside the box. This time, Harrison is given the time and space to crash a left-footed effort towards the goal, with his strike going well over the bar.
Beto wrestles for the ball against Evans on the halfway line, throwing his arm in the face of the centre-back. Everton's attack comes to nothing, but Evans isn’t happy with the striker. However, VAR sees no wrongdoing from the Portuguese forward.
Godfrey gets to the byline and flashes a cross into the box, but it goes just past Beto in the middle. Everton retain possession through McNeil, who looks for another cross. However, Varane shields it behind.
United gift the ball back to Everton again, but Mykolenko's strike from the edge is quickly blocked behind by Casemiro. Garner lifts his right-footed cross towards the back post, but Tarkowski cannot turn his header on target.
CHANCE! Another opportunity for Everton. Garner has space around him after playing a clever one-two outside United's box, but his strike is pushed away by Andre Onana. The goalkeeper pushes it straight out to Amadou Onana, who takes a touch before blasting his attempt well over.
Amadou Onana is the first player to be shown a yellow card after fouling Garnacho on the edge of the Everton box.
SAVE! Fernandes is denied his second goal. The captain takes responsibility for a free-kick just to the left outside the box and whips his right-footed effort towards the top-left corner. However, Pickford gets across his line to push it away at full stretch.
CHANCE! Wonderful play from United. Rashford has possession on the left and switches the play over to Fernandes on the right side of the box. He rolls it through to McTominay, who thumps a cutback towards Mainoo. However, Branthwaite slides it away before the flag goes up for offside.
Evans concedes possession in United's half to Beto, allowing Everton to commit men forward on the attack. McNeil receives it on the left on the edge of the box and drives a low strike just wide of the right post.
Everton are winless in 10 Premier League games (drawing five and losing five), the longest ongoing run of any side currently in the division. Only from August to October 1994 (12) have the Toffees ever had a longer winless run in the competition.
PENALTY UNITED! The hosts have the chance to double their lead after some superb work from Garnacho again. The Argentine drives from right to left on the edge of the box before being clattered by Godfrey. Two clumsy moments have cost Everton, who have been threatening on the attack.
Doucoure is not happy with the penalty being given and is shown a yellow card.
GOALLLL! RASHFORD SCORES! 2-0 UNITED! Fernandes scored the last penalty but gives this one to Rashford. The England international stutters on his run towards the ball before driving his strike into the bottom-left corner. Pickford commits himself the other way.
Garnacho is the first player to win two penalties in a single Premier League game since Antonio Rudiger for Chelsea v Leeds in December 2021, and the first ever to do so for United.
Everton win a free-kick just inside United's half. Pickford launches the ball forward, but Casemiro gets up head it away from danger just inside the box.
Everton have the 10th-highest xG in the Premier League this season (42.5), but the third-lowest goal total (29), giving them the biggest difference between expected goals and goals scored in the competition this term (13.5). The Toffees have created an xG of 0.9 against United, but have only hit the target twice with their nine shots.
Fernandes has possession in United's box, but he sends a pass straight to McNeil. The ball then rolls to Godfrey, who drives a low shot from the edge towards the bottom-left corner, but it deflects off Evans and goes behind.
Godfrey is well up the pitch, so when Everton concede possession, it gives Fernandes the chance to dash into the space left behind by the right-back. He gets into the box and attempts to curl a pass into the middle with the outside of his foot, but the ball is blocked, and Pickford comes out to claim it.
PENALTY SHOUT! United want a third penalty. Garnacho rushes down the right and gets to the byline before cutting the ball back across the box. Mykolenko slides to the floor, and the ball hits his supporting hand, but no penalty is given. Ten Hag is furious.
There will be four minutes of additional time.
Mainoo and McTominay combine down the left side of the box, but the ball gets trapped under the feet of the Scotland international. He rolls a pass back to Casemiro on the edge of the box, with the midfielder's low, first-time strike blocked by Onana.
Garnacho has been United's best player. He breaks forward on the right and drives into the box, faking it shoot to put Branthwaite on the floor before the centre-back gets across to recover. He had options in the middle, but nobody was complaining after his first-half performance.
HALF-TIME: MANCHESTER UNITED 2-0 EVERTON
United scored two penalties in the first half to lead a wasteful Everton 2-0 heading into half-time at Old Trafford. Garnacho was the Red Devils' star, winning both spot-kicks to give the hosts a comfortable advantage. He was first tripped by Tarkowski, allowing captain Fernandes to curl his spot-kick into the bottom-right corner. Harrison and Garner tested Onana, but it was Ten Hag's men that scored again. Garnacho was tricky on the edge of the box, driving across from right to left before being bundled to the floor by Godfrey. Rashford took the penalty this time, stuttering with his run towards the ball before directing his shot into the bottom-left corner.
It looks like United deserve their lead by a distance at half-time after creating an xG of 2.02, but the statistics have been heavily inflated by the two penalties. Despite not getting an assist to his name, Garnacho has been their best player, constantly driving at the Everton defence and winning two penalties. As for Everton, it's more of the same. Dyche was getting frustrated in the dugout, and there should be no surprise with his side failing to convert their opportunities again. The away side have registered an xG of 1.07 from their 11 shots but have only hit the target twice. They have had 29 final third entries and 17 touches inside the opposition box but nothing to show for it.
Everton get the ball rolling again. They need an early goal in the second half if they want to get back into the contest. The Toffees are on their way to an 11th consecutive Premier League game without a win.
United have won 180 and lost none of the 185 previous occasions they have been two or more goals ahead at half-time in the Premier League (drawing five). Meanwhile, away from home, Everton have lost 54 and won none of the 57 previous times they have been two or more goals behind at the break in the competition (drawing three). Not an encouraging statistic if you’re an Everton fan or Dyche. The Toffees have had most of the possession since the restart and are trying to build an attack.
Harrison collects the ball in the middle of United's half and spreads a pass down the right to Godfrey, who sends his cross behind for a goal-kick. Young or Coleman are better going forward than the former Norwich City man, but they are on the bench.
CHANCE! Everton go short with a free-kick on the left, unleashing McNeil on the wing. His inswinging cross is headed into the path of Doucoure by Tarkowski, but his strike in the middle of the box is blocked by McTominay.
Doucoure is Everton’s top scorer in the Premier League with six goals this season, though he hasn’t scored since December. Since Dyche became manager of the club last February, the Toffees have won 36 per cent of their league games when Doucoure starts (13/36), winning none of their nine when he doesn’t (drawing three and losing six).
OVER! Garnacho goes close! Fernandes spins in possession in the heart of Everton's half and rolls a pass out to Garnacho, who drives into the box. He is put under pressure by Mykolenko and lifts his right-footed strike over the bar.
Everton try to build an attack around the halfway line, but Onana puts too much power on his first-time pass, sending the ball out for a goal-kick. The Toffees are getting some substitutes ready to come on.
Beto has his first shot inside United's box, but his attempt is blocked. The ball spins up in the air, with the forward heading a pass down to Doucoure. The midfielder drives a low strike towards the near post, but Onana stops it with his feet.
WIDE! McTominay battles with Garner inside United's half, pushing him away before slotting a pass down the left to Fernandes. He gets into Everton's defensive third and sends an inviting cross towards Garnacho, but he pokes his effort wide on the slide.
Dyche has seen enough and has decided to make three changes. Beto has had 24 touches and one shot up front for Everton and is being replaced by Calvert-Lewin. The Englishman has scored three goals in 23 appearances.
Harrison also makes his way off the pitch at the nearest side. Dobbin is on, with his only Premier League goal coming against Chelsea in a 2-0 win earlier in the season.
There is also a straight swap in the midfield. Doucoure is replaced by Gomes.
SAVE! Brave from Pickford! Fernandes' inswinging cross from the right bobbles around the middle of the box, with Lindelof poking his shot towards the goal. Pickford claims it under pressure from Evans, who catches the goalkeeper and apologises immediately.
Gomes has space outside United's box and rolls a pass down the right to Dobbin for his first involvement. He takes a heavy touch but still finds a way to win a corner off Lindelof.
Lindelof barges into the back of Onana trying to win possession and gives away a poor free-kick in shooting range for Everton. The experienced Gomes takes aim from range, but his right-footed strike is blocked by the wall.
OVER! Dobbin gets a shot away, but it’s poor. Calvert-Lewin wrestles for the ball on the edge of the box but cannot turn away from his marker and rolls the ball back to Dobbin, who lashes a first-time strike with his left foot high and wide.
McTominay crashes into the back of Onana and is shown a yellow card. He was desperate to win possession in Everton's half, but he was clumsy.
United’s 40 Premier League wins against Everton is the joint-most one side has against another in the competition’s history, with the Red Devils also winning 40 times against Villa. They have only had four shots in the second half compared to Everton's seven, but they look comfortable. However, a shock goal from the Toffees could put them under pressure.
Nothing seems to be happening for Calvert-Lewin. He is working hard up front and puts pressure on Varane, but his back to Onana just about has enough weight on it for the goalkeeper to get there and clear. The Toffees get it back through McNeil. However, his cross goes straight to the goalkeeper.
There is a light round of applause from the home fans around the dugout as Young steps away from the bench to come on. He replaces Garner, who also spent time at the Red Devils.
WIDE! How have Everton not scored? Mykolenko flashes a brilliant cross from the left over to Godfrey, who heads the ball back across the goal. Dobbin is there, but his shot from a narrow angle goes back across Andre Onana and wide. He might have been looking for Calvert-Lewin, who was looking the other way.
Amadou Onana goes for an ambitious overhead kick from outside the box, but his shot is saved with ease by Andre Onana. That would have been goal of the season if it went in, but it never looked likely.
United make their first change. Mainoo was comfortable in the midfield and won three of his duels, but is now coming off for Amrabat.
Everton have had twice as many shots in the second half than United (8-4), also having more touches in the box (16-11). However, they have only created an xG of 0.41 since the restart and have had too many nearly moments.
McNeil floats a corner from the right onto Calvert-Lewin, but he cannot get enough power on his header, with the ball going straight into Onana's gloves.
Garnacho is denied the chance of an unlikely hat-trick of penalty wins, but he will be delighted with his contributions, turning the contest in United's favour with his direct runs into the box. He is off for Antony, who still has a lot to prove.
Young gets down the right and whips a corner towards the back post, with Mykolenko getting forward. Antony gets back well to defend it, forcing the left-back to direct his header wide.
United's work was done in the first half with the two penalties that they scored, but their performance since the restart has been pretty flat. They have only registered an xG of 0.54, hitting the target with two of their four shots. If Everton weren’t so clumsy in their box, the Red Devils would be playing in a much closer contest.
Chermiti comes on for his 11th Premier League appearance for Everton, still waiting for his first goal. Mykolenko is off, in what is a very late attacking change from Dyche, who probably should’ve done it a lot earlier.
United switch experience for youth in the defence. Evans is off for Kambwala, who makes his fourth Premier League appearance at centre-back for the hosts.
There will be four minutes of additional time.
Antony surges down the left and wins a late corner off Branthwaite. Fernandes elects to take it short, and the hosts work it out to Dalot outside the box, but he curls his right-footed strike straight at Pickford.
It's interesting that United are two goals ahead and have only made three changes, but Diallo hasn’t been given an opportunity off the bench. He has plenty of potential but only made two Premier League appearances this season.
OFFSIDE! Fernandes skips past a couple of tackles and slides a pass through to Rashford. He gets into the box and skips past Branthwaite, who takes down the forward. The referee blows for a penalty before changing his arm movement for an offside call.
FULL-TIME: MANCHESTER UNITED 2-0 EVERTON
Fernandes and Rashford scored first-half penalties for United to help the Red Devils beat Everton 2-0 at Old Trafford. It was more frustration for Dyche, who watched his team extend their run to 11 games without a win in the Premier League despite creating an xG of 1.48. Ten Hag's men made the most of their wasteful attacking and clumsy tackles, with Garnacho winning two penalties. First tripped by Tarkowski, captain Fernandes took responsibility from the spot and curled his shot into the bottom-right corner. Godfrey was the next player to barge into Garnacho inside the box after a tricky run from the Argentine. Rashford drilled his shot into the opposite corner, with United becoming just the third team in Premier League history to have two different players score a penalty in the first half. Everton had 12 attempts in the second half but couldn’t make any of their chances count. Dobbin had their best opportunity, but he flashed his effort across goal and away from danger. Next, United host Liverpool in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. As for Everton, they go to Bournemouth in the Premier League in three weeks. That's all for today, goodbye.
summary:
Relegation-battling Burnley showed their fighting spirit by twice coming from behind despite playing most of the match with 10 men to draw 2-2 against Chelsea in a thrilling match at Stamford Bridge. 
Dara O’Shea’s late header claimed a point for Burnley after Lorenz Assignon had been sent off in the first half that could have been won by both sides late on.
How the match unfolded
There were two Chelsea changes as Benoit Badiashile and Mykhailo Mudryk came in, while  Burnley made two changes too. David Datro Fofana was ineligible against his parent club, so Lyle Foster was brought in as was Zeki Amdouni. 
Chelsea almost went ahead in the opening 10 minutes but Enzo Fernandez’s deflected strike was tipped on to the woodwork by Arijanet Muric in the Burnley goal. But Burnley threatened as Foster forced Djordje Petrovic into a full-length save. 
Muric again was called into action in the 19th minute as Nicolas Jackson weaved his way into the area but the Burnley ’keeper blocked his shot. From the resulting corner Chelsea thought they had gone in front after Axel Disasi had bundled the ball in at the back post, but the goal was overturned as the Chelsea defender had used his arm to score. 
Chelsea broke the deadlock just before half-time from the penalty spot. Mudryk overran a through-ball but Assignon bundled the winger over to concede the spot-kick and earn himself a second yellow card. Also sent off was Burnley boss Vincent Kompany for his protests. 
Cole Palmer stepped up to score his 12th league goal of the season and his 20th goal involvement of the campaign, only the fifth time a Chelsea player has done so in the Premier League. 
But inside the opening two minutes of the second half Burnley went level with a brilliant strike from Josh Cullen. The midfielder exchanged passes with Josh Brownhill and, although the ball was at an awkward height, Cullen lashed it first time into the net from outside the area for his first Premier League goal.
Burnley almost made it 2-1 through Foster’s header, but Petrovic stretched to his right to save. 
Palmer made Chelsea’s man advantage finally count in the 78th minute with a beautiful goal. Fernandez’s vertical pass was cleverly flicked by substitute Raheem Sterling to Palmer, who turned and clinically buried the ball into the far corner. 
O’Shea put Burnley back level in the 81st minute with a header that Petrovic was unable to keep out. 
Sterling then had a glorious chance to restore Chelsea’s lead but skewed a close-range shot wide. 
Burnley substitute Jay Rodriguez almost gave Burnley a famous win, his header hitting the bar before his follow-up volley off-balance was skied over. 
The point means Chelsea remain 11th on 40 points, while Burnley have 18 points in 19th, effectively five points from safety because of their poor goal difference.
Club reports
Chelsea report | Burnley report
Match officials
Referee: Darren England. Assistants: Stuart Burt, Dan Cook. Fourth official: James Bell. VAR: John Brooks. Assistant VAR: Akil Howson.
text:
["Hello and welcome to live coverage of the Premier League clash between Team_14 and Team_9 at Old Trafford.
United manager Erik ten Hag is under increased pressure after back-to-back defeats in the Premier League have seen his side slip 11 points behind fourth-placed Team_2 and a guaranteed place in next season's Champions League. The Red Devils had strung four consecutive top-flight wins together in February to put them in a strong position, but defeats to Team_10 and Team_13 have seen them drop to sixth place. United looked like they were on for a shock victory in the derby when Marcus Rashford gave them the lead with a thunderous strike heading into half-time. However, a brace from Phil Foden and a goal from Erling Haaland gave the Citizens a deserved victory, beating them 3.33-0.25 on xG (expected goals). As Team_2 and Team_18 play against each other tomorrow, one of United's rivals for a Champions League spot will certainly drop points, but it will only matter if the hosts win today.
Team_9 were handed a boost before their last Premier League outing against Team_19, with their appeal to reduce their 10-point punishment for breaching Profit and Sustainability Rules to six points lifting them from 17th to 15th. As a result, the Toffees moved five points clear of the relegation zone. However, their disappointing run in the top-flight continued, with the Hammers' stoppage-time victory extending Team_9 winless run to 10 games. They also had the lead at half-time after Beto made up for his penalty miss by scoring a header, but goals from Kurt Zouma, Tomas Soucek and\xa0Edson Alvarez\xa0helped David Moyes' men to all three points at Goodison Park. There is another possible points deduction for Team_9 looming, so an upturn in results is desperately needed for Sean Dyche to push them well away from the drop zone.
Team_14 (4-2-3-1): Andre Onana; Diogo Dalot, Raphael Varane, Jonny Evans, Victor Lindelof; Kobbie Mainoo, Casemiro; Scott McTominay, Bruno Fernandes, Alejandro Garnacho; Marcus Rashford.
Team_14 SUBS: Altay Bayindir, Sofyan Amrabat, Christian Eriksen, Amad Diallo, Antony, Dermot Mee, Willy Kambwala, Toby Collyer, Habeeb Ogunneye.
Team_9 (4-5-1): Jordan Pickford; Ben Godfrey, James Tarkowski, Jarrad Branthwaite, Vitalii Mykolenko; Jack Harrison, Amadou Onana, Abdoulaye Doucoure, James Garner, Dwight McNeil; Beto.
Team_9 SUBS: Nathan Patterson, Michael Keane, Dominic Calvert-Lewin, Joao Virginia, Ashley Young, Andre Gomes, Seamus Coleman, Youssef Chermiti, Lewis Dobbin.
United select the same side that started their 3-1 defeat to rivals City in their previous Premier League outing. Evans and Rashford were forced off with injuries against the Citizens but are fit enough to keep their place in the team. Youngsters Collyer and Ogunneye are on the bench and could make their top-flight debut for the Red Devils.
Dyche also keeps the faith in his side that were beaten 3-1 by Team_19 in their last match. There was a chance that Idrissa Gueye could’ve been fit enough to feature, but he hasn’t recovered from a groin injury and is out of the squad.
United have won all three of their Premier League games against Team_9 since the start of last season, while they last won four league meetings in a row against the Toffees from November 2006 to December 2007. Both teams are on the pitch and are ready to get started.
United get this Premier League clash under way. Fernandes has the first kick. Both teams desperately need a win.
United are put under pressure by Team_9 early pressure in their defensive third, but Beto's low cross is blocked. The ball bobbles around the box, and neither side can take control, but the Red Devils eventually win it back.
McNeil wins an early corner on the left, with Garner strolling over to take it. However, his inswinging cross is headed away by Evans.
McNeil swings a deep cross from the left into the box, with Amadou Onana attacking it. The ball drops to Godfrey, who attempts to flick a shot at goal, but Andre Onana rushes off his line bravely to smother it.
Fernandes collects possession in the middle of Team_9 half and offloads a pass to Garnacho on his right. He strides forward and rolls the ball into Dalot, but he takes a heavy touch inside the box, allowing Onana to clear it well away.
Team_9 are looking sharp, but it could be that United are also gifting them the ball too often. Beto slides a pass out to Doucoure on the right, but his cross is claimed by Onana, who dives across the box.
CHANCE! United go close out of nothing! Fernandes has the ball in United's half and switches the play over to Rashford, who darts down the left and into space. He gets past Mykolenko to get a shot away, but Harrison does brilliantly to get back and make an important block.
Fernandes takes the following corner from the right, swinging the ball onto Casemiro's header. However, his flicked effort is easily saved by Pickford.
PENALTY UNITED! The hosts have a chance to take the lead from the spot! Rashford comes down the left and slides a pass into Garnacho, who flicks the ball past Tarkowski and is tripped inside the box. There is a VAR check for offside, but the penalty stands!
GOALLLL!\xa0FERNANDES SCORES! 1-0 UNITED! What a penalty from Fernandes! The captain is cool under pressure, curling his penalty into the bottom-right corner. Pickford goes the right way, but he is beaten by the accuracy of the strike.
CHANCE! Team_9 almost responded immediately. The ball drops kindly to McNeil on the box, with the winger volleying a left-footed effort just wide of the left post. Onana could only stand and watch the ball go just wide.
There is a loud atmosphere at Old Trafford, which could be inspired by the recent news that new co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe wants to build a new stadium. There has been some backlash, but all the home fans will set aside their concerns today and focus on supporting their side, looking to help United avoid defeat for the first time in three matches. Fernandes' goal came at the right time, with Team_9 building in confidence after a bright start.
Branthwaite has possession in Team_9 half and looks to roll a throughball behind United's defence and into Beto, but the flag goes up for offside immediately. The striker was quite far off, as the play wasn't even allowed to continue to its conclusion.
Varane comes forward down the left and switches a pass over to Garnacho on the right. He is in space and cuts the ball into Fernandes in the middle of the box, but he scoops his first-time strike well over.
United regain possession on the halfway line, with McTominay ignoring Garnacho on the right and instead looking for Rashford on the left. However, he puts too much power on the ball, allowing Pickford to run off his line to claim it just inside the box.
Team_9 are getting shots away, but they are all coming from outside the box. This time, Harrison is given the time and space to crash a left-footed effort towards the goal, with his strike going well over the bar.
Beto wrestles for the ball against Evans on the halfway line, throwing his arm in the face of the centre-back. Team_9 attack comes to nothing, but Evans isn’t happy with the striker. However, VAR sees no wrongdoing from the Portuguese forward.
Godfrey gets to the byline and flashes a cross into the box, but it goes just past Beto in the middle. Team_9 retain possession through McNeil, who looks for another cross. However, Varane shields it behind.
United gift the ball back to Team_9 again, but Mykolenko's strike from the edge is quickly blocked behind by Casemiro. Garner lifts his right-footed cross towards the back post, but Tarkowski cannot turn his header on target.
CHANCE! Another opportunity for Team_9. Garner has space around him after playing a clever one-two outside United's box, but his strike is pushed away by Andre Onana. The goalkeeper pushes it straight out to Amadou Onana, who takes a touch before blasting his attempt well over.
Amadou Onana is the first player to be shown a yellow card after fouling Garnacho on the edge of the Team_9 box.
SAVE! Fernandes is denied his second goal. The captain takes responsibility for a free-kick just to the left outside the box and whips his right-footed effort towards the top-left corner. However, Pickford gets across his line to push it away at full stretch.
CHANCE! Wonderful play from United. Rashford has possession on the left and switches the play over to Fernandes on the right side of the box. He rolls it through to McTominay, who thumps a cutback towards Mainoo. However, Branthwaite slides it away before the flag goes up for offside.
Evans concedes possession in United's half to Beto, allowing Team_9 to commit men forward on the attack. McNeil receives it on the left on the edge of the box and drives a low strike just wide of the right post.
Team_9 are winless in 10 Premier League games (drawing five and losing five), the longest ongoing run of any side currently in the division. Only from August to October 1994 (12) have the Toffees ever had a longer winless run in the competition.
PENALTY UNITED! The hosts have the chance to double their lead after some superb work from\xa0Garnacho again. The Argentine drives from right to left on the edge of the box before being clattered by Godfrey. Two clumsy moments have cost Team_9, who have been threatening on the attack.
Doucoure is not happy with the penalty being given and is shown a yellow card.
GOALLLL! RASHFORD SCORES! 2-0 UNITED! Fernandes scored the last penalty but gives this one to Rashford. The England international stutters on his run towards the ball before driving his strike into the bottom-left corner. Pickford commits himself the other way.
Garnacho is the first player to win two penalties in a single Premier League game since Antonio Rudiger for Team_7 v Leeds in December 2021, and the first ever to do so for United.
Team_9 win a free-kick just inside United's half. Pickford launches the ball forward, but Casemiro gets up head it away from danger just inside the box.
Team_9 have the 10th-highest xG in the Premier League this season (42.5), but the third-lowest goal total (29), giving them the biggest difference between expected goals and goals scored in the competition this term (13.5). The Toffees have created an xG of 0.9 against United, but have only hit the target twice with their nine shots.
Fernandes has possession in United's box, but he sends a pass straight to\xa0McNeil. The ball then rolls to Godfrey, who drives a low shot from the edge towards the bottom-left corner, but it deflects off Evans and goes behind.
Godfrey is well up the pitch, so when Team_9 concede possession, it gives Fernandes the chance to dash into the space left behind by the right-back. He gets into the box and attempts to curl a pass into the middle with the outside of his foot, but the ball is blocked, and Pickford comes out to claim it.
PENALTY SHOUT! United want a third penalty. Garnacho rushes down the right and gets to the byline before cutting the ball back across the box. Mykolenko slides to the floor, and the ball hits his supporting hand, but no penalty is given. Ten Hag is furious.
There will be four minutes of additional time.
Mainoo and McTominay combine down the left side of the box, but the ball gets trapped under the feet of the Scotland international. He rolls a pass back to Casemiro on the edge of the box, with the midfielder's low, first-time strike blocked by Onana.
Garnacho has been United's best player. He breaks forward on the right and drives into the box, faking it shoot to put Branthwaite on the floor before the centre-back gets across to recover. He had options in the middle, but nobody was complaining after his first-half performance.
HALF-TIME: Team_14 2-0 Team_9
United scored two penalties in the first half to lead a wasteful Team_9 2-0 heading into half-time at Old Trafford. Garnacho was the Red Devils' star, winning both spot-kicks to give the hosts a comfortable advantage. He was first tripped by Tarkowski, allowing captain Fernandes to curl his spot-kick into the bottom-right corner. Harrison and Garner tested Onana, but it was Ten Hag's men that scored again. Garnacho was tricky on the edge of the box, driving across from right to left before being bundled to the floor by Godfrey. Rashford took the penalty this time, stuttering with his run towards the ball before directing his shot into the bottom-left corner.
It looks like United deserve their lead by a distance at half-time after creating an xG of 2.02, but the statistics have been heavily inflated by the two penalties. Despite not getting an assist to his name, Garnacho has been their best player, constantly driving at the Team_9 defence and winning two penalties. As for Team_9, it's more of the same. Dyche was getting frustrated in the dugout, and there should be no surprise with his side failing to convert their opportunities again. The away side have registered an xG of 1.07 from their 11 shots but have only hit the target twice. They have had 29 final third entries and 17 touches inside the opposition box but nothing to show for it.
Team_9 get the ball rolling again. They need an early goal in the second half if they want to get back into the contest. The Toffees are on their way to an 11th consecutive Premier League game without a win.
United have won 180 and lost none of the 185 previous occasions they have been two or more goals ahead at half-time in the Premier League (drawing five). Meanwhile, away from home, Team_9 have lost 54 and won none of the 57 previous times they have been two or more goals behind at the break in the competition (drawing three). Not an encouraging statistic if you’re an Team_9 fan or Dyche. The Toffees have had most of the possession since the restart and are trying to build an attack.
Harrison collects the ball in the middle of United's half and spreads a pass down the right to Godfrey, who sends his cross behind for a goal-kick. Young or Coleman are better going forward than the former Norwich City man, but they are on the bench.
CHANCE! Team_9 go short with a free-kick on the left, unleashing McNeil on the wing. His inswinging cross is headed into the path of Doucoure by Tarkowski, but his strike in the middle of the box is blocked by McTominay.
Doucoure is Team_9’s top scorer in the Premier League with six goals this season, though he hasn’t scored since December. Since Dyche became manager of the club last February, the Toffees have won 36 per cent of their league games when Doucoure starts (13/36), winning none of their nine when he doesn’t (drawing three and losing six).
OVER!\xa0Garnacho goes close! Fernandes spins in possession in the heart of Team_9 half and rolls a pass out to Garnacho, who drives into the box. He is put under pressure by Mykolenko and lifts his right-footed strike over the bar.
Team_9 try to build an attack around the halfway line, but Onana puts too much power on his first-time pass, sending the ball out for a goal-kick. The Toffees are getting some substitutes ready to come on.
Beto has his first shot inside United's box, but his attempt is blocked. The ball spins up in the air, with the forward heading a pass down to Doucoure. The midfielder drives a low strike towards the near post, but Onana stops it with his feet.
WIDE! McTominay battles with Garner inside United's half, pushing him away before slotting a pass down the left to Fernandes. He gets into Team_9 defensive third and sends an inviting cross towards Garnacho, but he pokes his effort wide on the slide.
Dyche has seen enough and has decided to make three changes. Beto has had 24 touches and one shot up front for Team_9 and is being replaced by Calvert-Lewin. The Englishman has scored three goals in 23 appearances.
Harrison also makes his way off the pitch at the nearest side. Dobbin is on, with his only Premier League goal coming against Team_7 in a 2-0 win earlier in the season.
There is also a straight swap in the midfield. Doucoure is replaced by Gomes.
SAVE! Brave from Pickford! Fernandes' inswinging cross from the right bobbles around the middle of the box, with Lindelof poking his shot towards the goal. Pickford claims it under pressure from Evans, who catches the goalkeeper and apologises immediately.
Gomes has space outside United's box and rolls a pass down the right to Dobbin for his first involvement. He takes a heavy touch but still finds a way to win a corner off Lindelof.
Lindelof barges into the back of Onana trying to win possession and gives away a poor free-kick in shooting range for Team_9. The experienced Gomes takes aim from range, but his right-footed strike is blocked by the wall.
OVER! Dobbin gets a shot away, but it’s poor. Calvert-Lewin wrestles for the ball on the edge of the box but cannot turn away from his marker and rolls the ball back to Dobbin, who lashes a first-time strike with his left foot high and wide.
McTominay crashes into the back of Onana and is shown a yellow card. He was desperate to win possession in Team_9 half, but he was clumsy.
United’s 40 Premier League wins against Team_9 is the joint-most one side has against another in the competition’s history, with the Red Devils also winning 40 times against Villa. They have only had four shots in the second half compared to Team_9 seven, but they look comfortable. However, a shock goal from the Toffees could put them under pressure.
Nothing seems to be happening for\xa0Calvert-Lewin. He is working hard up front and puts pressure on Varane, but his back to Onana just about has enough weight on it for the goalkeeper to get there and clear. The Toffees get it back through McNeil. However, his cross goes straight to the goalkeeper.
There is a light round of applause from the home fans around the dugout as Young steps away from the bench to come on. He replaces Garner, who also spent time at the Red Devils.
WIDE! How have Team_9 not scored? Mykolenko flashes a brilliant cross from the left over to Godfrey, who heads the ball back across the goal. Dobbin is there, but his shot from a narrow angle goes back across Andre Onana and wide. He might have been looking for Calvert-Lewin, who was looking the other way.
Amadou Onana goes for an ambitious overhead kick from outside the box, but his shot is saved with ease by Andre Onana. That would have been goal of the season if it went in, but it never looked likely.
United make their first change. Mainoo was comfortable in the midfield and won three of his duels, but is now coming off for Amrabat.
Team_9 have had twice as many shots in the second half than United (8-4), also having more touches in the box (16-11). However, they have only created an xG of 0.41 since the restart and have had too many nearly moments.
McNeil floats a corner from the right onto Calvert-Lewin, but he cannot get enough power on his header, with the ball going straight into Onana's gloves.
Garnacho is denied the chance of an unlikely hat-trick of penalty wins, but he will be delighted with his contributions, turning the contest in United's favour with his direct runs into the box. He is off for Antony, who still has a lot to prove.
Young gets down the right and whips a corner towards the back post, with Mykolenko getting forward. Antony gets back well to defend it, forcing the left-back to direct his header wide.
United's work was done in the first half with the two penalties that they scored, but their performance since the restart has been pretty flat. They have only registered an xG of 0.54, hitting the target with two of their four shots. If Team_9 weren’t so clumsy in their box, the Red Devils would be playing in a much closer contest.
Chermiti comes on for his 11th Premier League appearance for Team_9, still waiting for his first goal. Mykolenko is off, in what is a very late attacking change from Dyche, who probably should’ve done it a lot earlier.
United switch experience for youth in the defence. Evans is off for Kambwala, who makes his fourth Premier League appearance at centre-back for the hosts.
There will be four minutes of additional time.
Antony surges down the left and wins a late corner off Branthwaite. Fernandes elects to take it short, and the hosts work it out to Dalot outside the box, but he curls his right-footed strike straight at Pickford.
It's interesting that United are two goals ahead and have only made three changes, but Diallo hasn’t been given an opportunity off the bench. He has plenty of potential but only made two Premier League appearances this season.
OFFSIDE! Fernandes skips past a couple of tackles and slides a pass through to Rashford. He gets into the box and skips past Branthwaite, who takes down the forward. The referee blows for a penalty before changing his arm movement for an offside call.
FULL-TIME: Team_14 2-0 Team_9
Fernandes and Rashford scored first-half penalties for United to help the Red Devils beat Team_9 2-0 at Old Trafford. It was more frustration for Dyche, who watched his team extend their run to 11 games without a win in the Premier League despite creating an xG of 1.48. Ten Hag's men made the most of their wasteful attacking and clumsy tackles, with Garnacho winning two penalties. First tripped by Tarkowski, captain Fernandes took responsibility from the spot and curled his shot into the bottom-right corner. Godfrey was the next player to barge into Garnacho inside the box after a tricky run from the Argentine. Rashford drilled his shot into the opposite corner, with United becoming just the third team in Premier League history to have two different players score a penalty in the first half. Team_9 had 12 attempts in the second half but couldn’t make any of their chances count. Dobbin had their best opportunity, but he flashed his effort across goal and away from danger. Next, United host Team_11 in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. As for Team_9, they go to Team_3 in the Premier League in three weeks. That's all for today, goodbye."]
label: Exciting
